title.$t: extension popup sometimes flickers black while resizing

content.$t:
Create a popup that resizes itself dynamically.  Use -webkit-transition to 
animate the size change.  Sometimes, you'll see some black flickering within 
the popup while it resizes.  This looks like the ExtensionView drawing as 
solid black.  I haven't looked into why this happens.

title.$t: Unfortunate translation of "N Tabs" in the New Tab Page

content.$t: [Language] Russian [Version number] 4.0.222.12 (Official Build 29069) [OS details] Windows XP [Where is the poor translation?] The plural for "N Tabs" is translated as "Число вкладок: N". The translation does not fit into its region, so only the ridiculous "Число вкладок:" (which means "Tab count:") is visible to the user (and there is no immediate workaround to turn "N" visible).

we want it to look and feels more like part of Chrome than webpage. 
http://www.corp.google.com/~kansinee/_current_project/client/chrome/xtention/final_mocks/installed_items.png

title.$t: reorganize and clean up extension samples

content.$t:
The code in test/data/extensions/samples is a mix of sample code and test 
code.  We should move (and clean up) the real samples and put them in 
common/extensions/samples (or common/extensions/docs/samples) and move the 
tests up a directory and delete the samples dir.

Message displayed when no flash player is installed is wrong

content.$t: [Language] Estonian [Version number] 3.0.195.27 [OS details] Windows XP Home, SP3 [Where is the poor translation?] For example when there is not Flash player installed, the text in the box where an object of flash player should be reads "Adobe Flash Player lisandmoodulit ei installita Lisandmooduli allalaadimiseks vajutage siia". This means "Adobe Flash Player plug-in is not going to be installed Click here to download the plug-in". It should read "Adobe Flash Player lisandmoodul ei ole installitud. Lisandmooduli allalaadimiseks vajutage siia". [attach any screenshots below]

title.$t: extension popups don't ever shrink their height

content.$t:
If you increase the height of your content, the popup expands.  If you 
decrease the height of your content, the popup doesn't shrink its height.

(this may be a dup, but I can't find the original)

title.$t: need WebKit API for computing a RenderView's current intrinsic height

content.$t:
I added this feature request upstream:
https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=31036

James suggested that I should file a companion bug locally against the webkit 
API.

Getting this fixed for mstone-4 would be great, but it's not strictly a 
blocker, it's more of a polish thing.

title.$t: Bookmark manager sync UI doesn't show the expired credentials error

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Start chrome and provide a --sync-url to a server which expire the login cookie after a minute or so. 2. Enable sync by going to "Tools Menu" -> "Sync my bookmarks...". 3. Restart the browser after a minute and open the bookmark manager. 4. Observe. What is the expected output? The bookmark bar as well as the bookmark manager should show a sync error UI to notify the user that their credentials expired and that they need to re-login. What do you see instead? The bookmark bar correctly displays the "Sync error" UI. The bookmarks manager, on the other hand, still shows "Synced to foo@gmail.com". Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Installed extensions should not have the option to 'reload'

content.$t:
If you 'reload' a normal installed extensions on the management page, it puts 
it into development mode.

This is probably a bug, but bigger picture, it makes no sense to reload an 
installed extension, so we should remove that link for those.

title.$t: Uninstalling an extension that has a browser action and is disabled dchecks

content.$t: It is surprised to be asked to remove an extension and not find it.

title.$t: Extensions "Successful installation" bubble should have a close box

content.$t:
When an extension is installed, a bubble appears confirming the install. 
Currently, clicking on the bubble doesn't dismiss it and the only way to get 
rid of it is to click somewhere else. We should just add a close box to the 
upper right corner of the bubble.

title.$t: add a more visible (non-promotional) way to access chrome://extensions and gallery

content.$t:
From a product review:
The menu alone is too obscure of a way for users to get to extensions.  While 
we have plans for new-tab promotions (peel-back, tips service), those aren't 
access points either.

The current suggestion was some additional button or UI surface in the NTP, 
although Brian expressed concerns about this approach.

title.$t: would like a way to attribute renderer crashes to content scripts

content.$t:
from today's product review:
In order to measure the stability impact of extensions on Chrome, it would be 
good to have a way to attribute which renderer crashes were caused by content 
scripts.  This is likely impossible to do accurately, but we may be able to 
add some extra data to crash reports to help:
- are there any content scripts injected into this page?  (which extension 
ids?)
- is the current stack in an isolated world context?

Maybe there are other ideas.

title.$t: UTF-8 encoded userscripts run on every page

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.232.0 (Developer Build 30753) (it's been happening for a long time - only just decided to figure out why) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a userscript, any userscript. 2. Save it in UTF-8 encoding in the appropriate folder. 3. Visit a website and see that the script runs. What is the expected result? The script should run only on the site(s) described in the @match line. What happens instead? The script runs on every site. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. Of course the simple solution is to encode scripts in ANSI, but I have a couple of scripts that use Unicode characters that require encoding in UTF- 8. I used Notepad++ to change between encoding on my scripts. Example script: // ==UserScript== // @name bad script // @description runs on every website when encoded in UTF-8. // @match http://non.existant/web/site.htm // ==/UserScript== alert("you shouldn't be seeing this");

title.$t: Implement chrome.extension.getMessage()

content.$t:
This is already partly implemented, but this bug is to update it to be more 
like the proposal, here:

http://groups.google.com/group/chromium-
extensions/browse_thread/thread/78f661ff16fc8f6a#

Specifically, I think that we need to load message catalogs right before 
starting up the extension process.

Also, we should make this API work inside the content script. This will 
require sending the catalog data into renderers.

title.$t: Incomplete error message when deploying bad script extension

content.$t:
Load a content script extension which has its css property pointing to a file 
that does not exist.

Expected:
Some error message saying the css file does not exist.

Actual:
The following error msg:
"Could not load '' for content script."

title.$t: Add a warning about NPAPI to the docs

content.$t: Aaron to devise text.

title.$t: On sync setup wizard, 'Cancel' button jumps vertically on gaia login error page

content.$t:
As part of fixing issue 19738 I noticed that the 'Cancel' button jumps
around vertically on the 'Error signing in' page that is shown if you enter
invalid credentials on the first gaia login page.  Basically when you hit
submit, the error message disappears (the style is set to 'none'), so the
cancel button moves up.  I tried setting it to 'hidden' but that had the
same effect.

This should be fixed before stable.

title.$t: We need a good way to display source code of samples in the docs

content.$t:
If you go to 
http://code.google.com/chrome/extensions/trunk/getstarted.html#code and 
click the _CSS and JavaScript code for hello_world_ link, you get a view-
source path that won't work in Opera or IE 6/7:

view-
source:http://code.google.com/chrome/extensions/trunk/samples/hello_world/p
opup.html

(view-source also doesn't work -- in chrome, at least -- if you're viewing 
the page using file://.)

We need a good way to view source files that are under the docs directory. 
Aaron's first thought was to use XHR to fetch the HTML, then plop it in a 
PRE element.

title.$t: When you disable an extension, the options button stays active

content.$t:
Install an extension that has an options page
Go to chrome://extensions
Disable an extension
Notice that the options button stays active.

title.$t: Omnibox/toolbar M5 updates: reload/star shuffle, lock move, icon modifications, hide http://

content.$t:
Behavior:

Icon is magnifying glass for empty field

Icon changes while user types, queries show mag, urls show globe, https 
show globe until connection is established

Clicking the proxy icon shows page info

Dragging the proxy icon drags the url

This replaces the HTTPS indicator on the right of the location bar

HTTP urls strip "http://" but https is still shown

Google searches are shown using the original query, not the google url.

Other changes:
Omnibox dropdown is aligned with omnibox, not the Star and go buttons.

title.$t: [Extensions] Should do a detail manifest validation when packing extension

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? Currently, many errors can be contained in manifest.json when packing extension, the are like: 1. missing required parameters, e.g. "name" is missing, should do some validation on required parameters. 2. "version" can be anything, like "asdfcc!@", should do some format check on version.

title.$t: SharedWorkers should not span incognito windows

content.$t:
Currently, incognito windows share shared workers with non-incognito 
windows. We should push the incognito status down into the worker code.

title.$t: Chrome://extensions/ page UI layout is not RTL in bidi language version chrome

content.$t: Chrome: 4.0.250.0 (البنية الرسمية 32149) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. launch Arabic chrome 2. navigate to chrome://extensions/ or open extension list page from tool menu What is the expected output? What do you see instead? for RTL language like Hebrew or Arabic, chrome UI element layout should implement RTL algorithm. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Let's not show the dangerous download roadblock for downloads off the gallery

content.$t:
That was only needed to prevent clickjacking attacks from evil webpages, 
which we are not concerned with on the gallery.

title.$t: Amend manifest docs to specify max title (45) and description (132) lengths.

content.$t: Self-explanatory.

title.$t: Old versions not removed after extensions update

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.258.0 (Developer Build 33214) URLs (if applicable) : n/a Other browsers tested: n/a What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install an extension. 2. Install a newer version of the same extension. What is the expected result? Old version of the extension is removed from the "\User Data\Default\Extensions\<extension ID>" folder. What happens instead? Old version of the extension is not removed. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: should be able to uninstall extensions by right-clicking on them

content.$t:
Not all extensions have UI, but for the ones that do I should be able to 
uninstall them by right-clicking on them and selecting Uninstall.

title.$t: Crash on complicated @font-face rule

content.$t: Reproduced on Linux tot (r33943) and Windows latest 4.0 dev channel (4.0.249.25? sorry, I don't have the PC right now). What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Start Chromium 2. Visit http://mwhenry.com/blog/examples/font-face-test/ 3. Press the reload button rapidly 10-20 times. What is the expected output? The page is rendered. What do you see instead? Chromium crashes (Aw Snap). Please use labels and text to provide additional information. - The page uses @font-face (aka WebFonts, remote fonts). - The crash occurs regardless of the OTS library is used (ENABLE_OPENTYPE_SANITIZER=1) or not (=0). - The crash does not occur when --disable-remote-fonts command line flag is used.

title.$t: 'Bookmark synch' link on NNTP does nothing, when synched.

content.$t:
Build: 4.0.249.30 (Official Build 33928)

-Sync your bookmarks.
-Open a NNTP and click on the link 'Bookmarks sync' of Promo info bubble.

Isue: 
Right now, it does nothing.

Expected:
We should either 
i) show the Chrome Options/Personal stuff tab  ( as we do from B'Manager 
and Menu) (OR)
ii) We should simply hide the 'bookmarks sync' link from the promo bar, in 
case if bookmarks are synced.

title.$t: Check/Unchecking 'Bookmark Sync' item from the action drop-down menu, should show/hide the status

content.$t:
Build: 4.0.249.30 (Official Build 33928)

I'm not pretty sure, whether we regressed here or not!, but will double 
check and will update the thread.

-Have a Bookmark sync and extensions status showing up at the bottom of 
the NNTP.
-Click on action drop-down menu button and uncheck 'Bookmark sync' option 
from the list.

Issue:
Does nothing.

Expected:
It should hide the status.

title.$t: The grey "installing..." bubble before extension install dialog must die

content.$t:
It makes me want to stab myself everytime I see it. It should only happen for 
themes.

title.$t: Download arrow should not show up for extension install

content.$t:
UI team, please comment...

It is distracting to have the big download arrow flash, especially since many 
times extensions download so fast you don't even see them.

There has been discussion about not showing the arrow if we can calculate 
that it looks like it's going to take more than xxx ms, but I think that is 
going to be hard, particularly since the arrow is supposed to start 
immediately.

I think it would be simpler to just not show the arrow at all for extensions.

title.$t: DNS queries not forwarded through SOCKS v5 proxies

content.$t: Chrome Version : SRWare Iron 4.0.227.0 (Developer Build 0) WebKit 532.3 V8 1.3.16.2 User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US) AppleWebKit/532.3 (KHTML, like Gecko) Iron/4.0.227.0 Chrome/4.0.227.0 Safari/532.3 Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Firefox 3.x: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. ssh -D 8008 remote.host 2. iron --proxy-server=socks5://127.0.0.1:8008 3. go to any website What is the expected result? That the DNS queries are forwarded through the SOCKS proxy. What happens instead? The DNS queries are performed from the local network Wireshark clearly shows the DNS queries happening on the local network before the page is downloaded through the SOCKS proxy. This has very odd results with Google's pages (google.com, youtube.com, gmail.com) in that they don't work at all while other pages (ask.com for example) are displayed without issue. These additional problems may be unique to my specific setup, but the lack of DNS forwarding is certainly not.

title.$t: Severe memory leak with all extension background pages

content.$t: Chrome Version : Google Chrome 4.0.249.30 (Official Build 33928) URLs (if applicable) : chrome-extension://* What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install an extension with a light, passive background page and a browser action popup, such as Tab Menu. 2. Open Google Chrome's task manager to observe the extension's memory usage. 3. Click the browser action popup a few times. 4. Observe the extension's updated memory usage. 5. Repeat steps 3 and 4 to observe memory leak. What is the expected output? Memory usage should be close to zero. What do you see instead? Memory usage keeps increasing What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Google Chrome 4.0 on Windows Vista. Please provide any additional information below. This bug applies to all Google Chrome versions that have extension suport enabled. I can be contacted via email regarding this matter. No spam please.

title.$t: Extension content scripts can get out of the sandbox via window.top

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.267.0 (34144) URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: N/A Firefox 3.x: N/A IE 7: N/A IE 8: N/A What steps will reproduce the problem? In any webpage which has <iframe>s, content scripts injected into the iframe page can access the client sites' javascript objects via window.top What is the expected result? Content scripts should not be able to access client sites' javascript objects, window.top should only contains objects created by the content script itself. What happens instead? Content scripts can access client sites' javascript objects like it's included by the client sites Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. I've attached an example extension, install it and visit: http://www.w3schools.com/TAGS/tryit.asp?filename=tryhtml_iframe It's w3c's demo page for the <iframe> tag, this page embeds www.w3cschools.com as an iframe, the example extension inserted a button at the top of the iframe, click it will display a function named 'displayad', which is not defined by the extension, but by w3cschools.com

title.$t: "Adobe Flash Player storage settings..."  links to the accessdenied.html page - ko, sv

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.1.249.1011 (office 39069) URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch Chrome with Korean UI 2. click Wrench => Options => Under the Hood => Content settings... 3. Click "Adobe Flash Player storage settings..." link What is the expected result? If "settings_manager07.html" isn't available for korean or Swedish, then the link should be displayed with English settings_manager07.html. http://www.macromedia.com/support/documentation/en/flashplayer/help/setting s_manager07.html What happens instead? The link goes to http://unavailable.adobe.com/accessdenied.html. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: "AutoFill Profiles"-feature information disclosure issue

content.$t:
Chrome Version       : 5.0.360.0 (42215)
URLs (if applicable) : http://0x7c.de/form_en.php

During some tests of Chrome's new "AutoFill Profiles" feature for Addresses
I discovered a simple way to submit all information of the user's personal
information, although the user might think he just entered and submitted
his first name using the autofill feature for Addresses.

For this purpose I crafted a html web page containing a simple feedback
form. In this form an user can type in his first name, rate the page and
give some short feedback. If the user begins to enter his real first name
(which is not uncommon) Chrome's autofill feature for Addresses comes in
place and suggests to autocomplete the user's first name, if the user saved
some personal information in the "AutoFill Profiles"-option. If the user
selects his first name the field will be filled as expected and the user
can continue to fill in the other input fields of my demo web page. If the
user hits the <SUBMIT>-button the feedback will be posted to the server and
(in this case) shows the submitted data.

In first instance this seems not critical, but the "magic" happens behind
the scenes. The form does not only contain a field for the user's first
name, it also contains fields for his phone number, email, address, etc.
But these fields were hidden using CSS and thus the user does not see that
these fields were automatically filled with his personal information.

I think that Chrome should prompt the user, *if* and especially *what*
personal data of the "AutoFill Profiles"-option were automatically filled
into a web page's form fields. So the user can decide, if he wants to
submit this information or not.

If you want to test my simple PoC, just enter http://0x7c.de/form_en.php

If you have any questions or comments, feel free to contact me.

Best regards,
Florian

title.$t: Test content and geolocation settings for IDN

content.$t:
I'm pretty sure our various content/geolocation settings UIs don't do well 
for IDN URLs.  Several places we do things like GURL::host(), which I believe 
gets a punycode string.  We need to be fixing this sort of thing up before 
displaying it to the user.

We should test things like the browser bubbles and exceptions dialogs.

title.$t: Security: Label Name truncation with long field values leading to autofill data theft

content.$t:
Chrome for Windows 5.0.376.0 (44209)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Define a profile with address entries. Give the value of first name as
"AbhishekNameisQuiteLong" and label name "abc".
2. Go to http://infernohacks.com/t/autofill/form.html.
3. type Ab, then drop down menu comes.
4. You will see your name. it is truncated with ... and label name is not
shown at all.
5. since user never sees label name, he or she think it is autocomplete and
not autofill and selects it.
6. thereby he or she loses all address and cc info.

we should not make autofill/autocomplete dropdown size by size of field as
attacker controls that. Also, we should never truncate label name as
otherwise user will confuse it with autocomplete.

James, do you agree with my analysis. I can also look to patch this once we
decide on the final solution.

title.$t: Encryptor abstraction should be removed / made Windows-specific

content.$t:
(Split off from bug 25404; see that bug for some of of the background.)

Encryptor is a thin abstraction of a Windows-specific API (from before the other platforms really 
existed). Doing secure local storage on the Mac should be done with the Keychain, and the 
Encryptor API is not really suitable for that. It's already not used for password storage (which is 
where it started), but its existence encourages new clients to design against that API and expect that 
the Mac will implement the guts at some point--as has now happened with AutoFill--rather than 
creating an abstraction that actually works for all platforms.

It will be much easier to do secure local storage correctly up-front than to go back and try to retro-
fit clients to a new API (as we had to do with the creation of PasswordStore, which was painful).

title.$t: Handle SSL servers that use tiny DH keys

content.$t:
This issue was first reported in Mozilla bug 583337:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=583337

A few SSL servers select the TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
cipher suite if we list it before TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
in the SSL ClientHello message, but they use tiny
(256-bit) Diffie-Hellman keys.

NSS 3.12.7 checks the DH key sizes.  With NSS 3.12.6
or earlier, we can work around these broken servers
by listing TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA after
TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA in the SSL ClientHello
message.

title.$t: Auto-updating across two versions with no open windows and without restarting the app causes it to hang

content.$t:
Kris, I'd like to get QA confirmation of this problem.  It may be 10.6-
specific or it may just be a fluke.  I've put proposed steps to reproduce 
below, although they're just a hypothesis based on what I experienced.

I left 237.0 running on crack, a 10.6 system, and disappeared for over a 
week.  There were no windows open.  When I came back, Chrome was 
hung.  Like a jury.  In the interim, Chrome had updated to 249.0 and then 
249.4 in the background.  Upon checking the disk, I found versioned 
directories for 249.0 and 249.4, but not the running version, 237.0.  This 
caused a return of the "Chrome hangs after auto-update" problem.

The .keystone_install script is responsible for checking for running 
Chromes and not removing the versioned directory.  Its policy is:

 - never delete the version being upgraded from
 - use ps and lsof to avoid deleting versions that appear to be in use

The ps and lsof checks can only look at the local machine and break down 
in certain network filesystem environments, but there was no network 
filesystem involved in this case.

The ps check can only find versions with running helper processes, such as 
renderer processes.  Because no windows were open, ps would have found 
no helpers associated with 237.0.

The lsof check can only report if the current user is running the version in 
question.  In this case, the update should have been performed as the 
same user that was running Chrome, and the 249.4 update should not 
have clobbered 237.0.

STEPS

1. Run version n-2.  Close all browser windows.
2. Auto-update to version n-1, but don't restart Chrome.  The update can 
probably be launched from the About box, but in my case, it was done in 
the background by Keystone.
3. Auto-update to version n, as above.
4. Try to go to a web site.

EXPECT: to be able to continue using version n-2 even if it is not restarted 
after the update to version n is applied.

OBSERVE: (apparently) version n-2 is hung, you can't open or use new 
windows, and the application crashes when you ask it to quit.

Upon restarting Chrome, you will be on version n regardless of any hangs 
or crashes.  The fix, if needed will be updater-side and will be effective 
immediately for any update that contains the fix, and will NOT be tied to 
the running Chrome version.  Accordingly, I'd like to get this for M4 if 
possible, but I don't consider it ReleaseBlock-Beta.

title.$t: Certificate information sheet can get hung and prevent closing Security Information windows

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open more than one Security Information window. (These can even be from the same site. See bug 34810. 2. Click the “Certificate information…” button in each. 3. Try to close the certificate information sheets. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect: the sheets are all closable. Observe: clicking the OK button on any sheet closes the most recently opened one. After that, the rest of the sheets aren't closable. Since the certificate sheet is modal on a Security Information window, all of these windows wind up totally unclosable. The controller probably thinks it's a singleton or something.

title.$t: DownloadManagerTest.TestDownloadFilename fails on the mac official builder

content.$t:
We have two machines behind the mac official builder, if you look, you'll see DownloadManagerTest.TestDownloadFilename fails some times.  It comes 
down to which machine it runs on.  :(

title.$t: GTMTheme should go away

content.$t:
GTMTheme came about before themes in chrome were sorted out.  Since 
then, it has gotten in the way more then helped.  We should remove it from 
the Cocoa code path, and use the core chrome theme classes directly to avoid 
overhead/confusion.

title.$t: Missing feature in Mac Version : Option-Menu of subfolders

content.$t: Chrome Version : <5.0.322.2 dev, MAC OS X 10.6> URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1 Right-clicking with the mouse over a subfolder of a folder on the bookmarks toolbar What is the expected result? An option-menu should appear (see attached screenshot) (this among others allows to open all bookmarks as tabs contained in that subfolder) This is a very much needed browser feature. It is correctly implemented on the Mac for the folders but not for the subfolders. Windows Chrome has it all. What happens instead? Nothing happens on the Mac-version, the Windows version has the feature. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Menu bar should be visible if a non-fullscreen (non-popup) window is frontmost, even if a fullscreen window is in the background

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go fullscreen 2. Cmd-N What is the expected result? Menu bar visible. What happens instead? Menu bar hidden. This is also important because of spaces. It's weird if you have a normal window and no menu bar just because there's a fullscreen window on a different space. See also http://repo.or.cz/w/MacVim.git/commit/9e6a567757440f016ffd2b80f3e0 a3c8d5ae42cb , though I doubt that that's very helpful :-P

title.$t: BrowserThemeProvider->HasCustomImage doing strange things

content.$t:
HCI plays very different roles in Mac and in Windows theme creation.  It seems 
to be called in superfluous places on the Mac side, and it may be that it can 
be dispensed with altogether.  Look into this.

title.$t: Can install extensions through an Incognito Window

content.$t: Platform: Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L31a) Processor: 2 Intel 2.33 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 5.0.332.0 r39309 QuickTime Player: 7.6.4 Flash Player: 10.0.42.34 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open an Ingonito window. 2. Install an extension (eg: Aviary - https://chrome.google.com/extensions/detail/ncgcgghbabbopfcpgcjpfffdgnbadegf?hl=en-US) Expected: We shouldn't be allowed to install extensions through an incognito window. (The way Windows and Linux Chrome work) Actual: We can install extensions and the infobubble for the installed extension is at the bottom of the screen. We don't see the installed extensions in the toolbar but, when we check in chrome://extensions we see that the extension is installed.

title.$t: Sync prefs shouldn't take room when they are invisible

Huge vertical gap. If sync is not active, its invisible label should not take up space and everything below should be moved up.

title.$t: Themed drawing needs to include one px highlight at the top of the window

content.$t:
Currently themes draw flat to the top of the window, not providing enough 
contrast with the window shadow. We need to draw:

1px
50% white
6px rounded corners
width should be outset by 0.5 px to make the left and right edges fall outside 
of window bounds
height should be inset by 0.5 px to make the edge fall just inside the top of 
window bounds.

title.$t: Close, Minimize and Zoom Show as Active while Mousing over Bookmark Buttons

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Start Chrome. 2. Have some bookmarks of any kind in the bookmarks bar. 3. Move the mouse over the bookmarks. What is the expected output? - The state of the window's close, minimize and zoom controls should not change. What do you see instead? - The window's close, minimize and zoom controls show as active (i.e. with a X — + shown over the buttons).

title.$t: Mac: Don't send client cert before verifying received server cert

content.$t:
The current Mac SSL code will sometimes send the client cert before verifying the server cert. This is 
considered incorrect behavior.

The user still has to choose and confirm a client cert before it's sent, and client certs don't usually 
contain sensitive information (i.e. no private key!), but this can be considered a privacy issue in that 
it allows the server to get some information about the viewer's identity under false pretenses.

According to wtc, this also affects Windows. We have no workaround on that platform due to API 
limitations, but the Mac SecureTransport API allows us to do things the right way; we just aren't, yet.

title.$t: Fade to and from fullscreen mode is too slow and jarring

content.$t: Chrome Version: 5.0.356.0 dev OS version : 10.6.2 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Activate fullscreen mode 2. Wait 3 seconds 3. Deactivate fullscreen mode What is the expected result? A smooth and quick transition. What happens instead? A slow and jarring transition. I just upgraded, and while I love fullscreen mode, the new transition is jarring. I feel strongly that it needs to be made much more subtle. It might be sufficient to just make it faster, I'm not sure.

title.$t: Trusted Pepper 2D plugins do not paint anything.

content.$t:
Chrome Version       : 5.0.359.0 (42181)

Test: use the pepper 2D test from src/webkit/tools/pepper_test_plugin, make sure that 
dimensions="2" in the <embed> tag in test_page.html.

Run Chromium on the Mac with these flags (note that both the --load-plugin= flag and the file: 
option might require an absolute path):

Chromium.app/Contents/MacOS/Chromium --no-sandbox --internal-nacl --internal-pepper -
-enable-gpu-plugin --load-
plugin=/chromium/src/xcodebuild/Debug/PepperTestPlugin.plugin 
file:///chromium/src/webkit/tools/pepper_test_plugin/test_page.html

With dimensions="2", I would expect to see a gradient rendered on the left-hand side of the 
page.  Instead, there is nothing.  Note that events are passed through to the plugin; you can tell 
because the log output shows them.

This issue is blocking development of the Native Client SDK.

title.$t: Remove wmode hack from Flash when Core Animation is available

content.$t:
Even after we enable Core Animation negotiation for Mac plugins, Flash won't use it because of our 
wmode hack (which we use to prevent them from using QuickDraw as an accelerated drawing mode 
when CA isn't available).

I have code ready to go for this, we just need to make sure there aren't any serious regressions 
before we do.

title.$t: Support brand codes in installer

content.$t:
We need to be able to create Mac installers with specific brand codes to 
track the effectiveness of marketing and bundling deals.

For now we need to support three codes: organic, marketing, and bundle. We 
can get specific codes from mlchan.

AFAIK, Keystone now supports sending the brand code in update pings. If so, 
we need to be able to build three .dmgs (Beta now, stable later). Each 
installer would stuff a different brand code into wherever keystone needs it.

This is, obviously, for Google Chrome builds only. It might be possible to 
just change the internal signing build to do this.

title.$t: Copying urls / dragging urls behavior, clarified

content.$t:
Using the new http hiding behavior, the following should occur:

A. Copy a url:
Rich text is "http://example.com" and whole string is linked to that url
Plain text is simply "http://example.com" 

B. Drag a url:
Rich text is "Page Title" and string is linked to url
Plain text is "http://example.com" 

If users have modified the text in the omnibox, we use behavior A all the time (since we don't know 
the page title) and we should make sure that http is included if a URL navigation action would have 
resulted. 


For Queries:
C. Drag an unsubmitted query:
Rich text is "Query string" and string is linked to the google.com search url
Plain text is simply the query string.

Seem reasonable?

The OS X chrome web notifications need improvements:
1. A 1px white border between the HTML payload and the 1xp black external border makes notification look bad. This border doesn't exist in Linux, for instance.
2. The notification corners are supposed to be rounded, but the rounded corner shows white pixels instead of whatever is inside, which looks bad.
3. The blue menu with bright white text at the bottom has no relationship with any other Chrome UI style or theme.

title.$t: Hardcoded colors in omnibox2 unreadable on some system themes

content.$t:
The old Omnibox code went to some length to ensure that text and background 
colors were always distinct enough (in luminance) that they would be 
readable.  The new code doesn't do this, and hardcodes some text colors 
(e.g. the light grey used for pieces of Suggest results that match the 
user's input), while taking other colors (e.g. the mouse hover color) from 
the user's theme, at least partly.

As a result, on Linus' Windows Classic box, a hovered suggestion is totally 
unreadable.  I suspect (but haven't tested) that a light-on-dark theme 
would result in even less readable text (i.e. all elements unreadable).

Not sure we can ship in a state where some users can't read our results :(

The solution here is probably to not hardcode text colors, and instead get 
them from the theme.

title.$t: Deadlock in Google Earth plugin

content.$t:
See http://b/2242480 for the full bug.

Here's the repro scenario

1. using chrome, open
http://earth-api-samples.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/demos/drive-
simulator/index.html
2. if you're prompted to install the Google Earth Plugin, go ahead and
do it -- the bug occurs with all plugin versions that I've tested
3. click "Go!" to retrieve driving directions
4. after the camera zooms into San Francisco, click "Start" to start
the car animating
5. click "+" twice to set the replay speed to 4x
6. wait



This is fixed in r34593.  Not sure if want to merge this to M4 or not.  I 
imagine it's pretty high priority for Earth folks.

title.$t: Chrome 6 can't load Picnik.com

content.$t: Chrome Version : 6.0.472.0 (Official Build 53024) dev URLs (if applicable) : http://www.picnik.com Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: OK Firefox 3.x: OK IE 7: OK IE 8: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. On Windows 7, but not OSX, go to http://www.picnik.com What is the expected result? Picnik loads and can be used. What happens instead? Picnik loading progress bar gets to ~80% and stalls there, seemingly forever. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. This problem has been present in Chrome 6 for awhile but Chrome 5 works as expected. From a debugger perspective it looks like one of the API calls it makes to our server either gets swallowed somehow or the response from the server isn't received. In debugging I've also seen an unusually high number of API call failures (Flash 2032 stream errors). Another data point, is that it works fine when I run against a local web server instead of production Picnik. I've captured these requests (the first a successful one on OSX, the second a hang on Win7) via net-internals. An additional data point, in my tests I've only seen HTTPS requests hang. title.$t: [CF] Url prefix approach (gcf:) should not work by default

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install Chrome Frame 6.0.472.54 (Official Build 58288) 2. Make sure "enablegcfprotocol" is not in CF registry 3. Access any Url with gcf: prefix What is the expected output? What do you see instead? It should show a blank page or error page since gcf: should not be recognized, but now page is rendered by CF. In other words, the Url prefix approach works by default. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: seccomp sandbox needs licenses on all files

content.$t:
E.g. sandbox/linux/seccomp/access.cc (and nearby files) all need a 
copyright/licence statement on them.

title.$t: Use after free crash in RTL text handling

content.$t:
(from https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=32749):

Open the following text:
data:text/html;charset=utf-8,שגדכשדגכשדגכ
%0A%0A11111111%20333333333333%202222222222222%20111111111111%2033333333333333%20111111111111%2011111111111%2011111111111%2011111111111%2011111111
1111%2011111111111111%2011111111111%2011111111111%2011111111%203333333%20111111111%2022222222222%203333333333%20

and then make the browser window narrower/wider to get the text to line wrap. 
It will soon crash because the InlineRunBox linked lists get corrupted leading
to calls on objects that have been already free()d.  The crash itself is under
RenderText::extractTextBox(), but it looks like the data structures are
corrupted sometime before then.  We're seeing some crashes in the wild in
Chrome with similar looking stacktraces.

This was initially reported by Google Wave and fixed upstream with http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/52527.  Since this is a use-after-free and 
the fix looks low-risk I think we should try to merge the fix into the 4.0 branch if that's still possible.

title.$t: Exported NACL plugin grabs symbol other plugins use

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. install mozplugger 2. load about:plugins What is the expected output? What do you see instead? When we fetch metadata from mozplugger.so, we end up with the MIME type from NACL. This is because mozplugger (incorrectly, but it works in Firefox) makes all of its symbols dynamic: $ objdump -T /usr/lib/mozilla/plugins/mozplugger.so | grep MIME 0000000000005100 g DF .text 000000000000017a Base NPP_GetMIMEDescription 0000000000005690 g DF .text 0000000000000005 Base NP_GetMIMEDescription When Chrome calls NP_GetMIMEDescription on it, internally mozplugger calls NPP_GetMIMEDescription, which Chrome is shadowing due to the impl in native_client/src/trusted/plugin_npp_launcher.cc. Normally Chrome marks all of its symbols hidden, but I turned this off for debug builds to fix something else. My own fault.

title.$t: Close new tabs opened using "target=_blank" that just download a file

content.$t:
- create a test page with the HTML 

<a target="_blank" href="DistccCluster.zip">click me</a>

where the file is some file that will cause a download to occur.
- open the page in chromium
- click the link

expected:
- new tab opens, file should download, tab should close

actual:
- tab opens, file downloads, but empty tab stays open

This works correctly in IE and Firefox, but not in Chromium. Darin told me 
to file and that we should be able to fix this.

title.$t: Strange UI behavior on [Show cookies and web site permissions] dialog

content.$t: Chrome Version : Google Chrome 4.0.249.78 (Official Build 36714) WebKit 532.5 V8 1.3.18.19 User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US) AppleWebKit/532.5 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/4.0.249.78 Safari/532.5 URLs (if applicable) : N/A Other browsers tested: N/A What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Spanner -> Options -> Show cookies and web site permissions 2. Type some word in [Search] text box, then push [Remove All] button 3. Both [Remove] button and [Remove All] button are disabled, and all stored cookies show up 4. Select any site in the tree view, but [Remove] button remains disabled and can't remove it 5. Once close the dialog and open it again it works. What is the expected result? [Remove] button should be enabled when any site in the tree view is selected (step 4 above). Probably [Remove All] button should be enabled when there's something in the tree view (step 3 above) What happens instead? Described above. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Clean up UglyHacks category in cookie manager

content.$t:
There are a couple of things that need cleaning up in the cookie manager, 
notably:

http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome/trunk/src/chrome/browser/cocoa/c
ookies_window_controller_unittest.mm?
r1=37695&r2=37694&pathrev=37695

- the UglyHacks category should go away
- "childs" is a horrid name for a method, it should be renamed to something 
else if we can't get rid of it altogether.

title.$t: [CF] *apache.org* doesn't work for Chrome Frame registry approach

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Have CF 5.0.317.0 (Official Build 38070) installed 2. Add *apache.org* to CF registry 3. Launch IE and access apache.org What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Ideally web site apache.org should be rendered by CF, but now it is still rendered by IE Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Add padding column between link and button in content blocked bubble

content.$t:
Right now with no padding, they can get crammed together on short 
hostnames.

title.$t: Content Settings dialog should be modal to parent window

content.$t:
The Content Settings dialog should be modal to its parent window if the 
parent window is the options dialog.

When the parent is the browser window (i.e. triggered by the content blocked 
bubble), I'm not so sure.  Ben, thoughts?  I'm leaning toward making that 
modal too.

title.$t: Remove descriptive text above import settings button

content.$t: Shouldn't be needed anymore with a more descriptive button.

title.$t: Add space in advanced prefs page

content.$t: ...between top button pair and text below.

title.$t: Add space in clear browsing data dialog

content.$t: ...between last checkbox and button pair.

title.$t: Handle popup no title case better

content.$t:
The popup blocked bubble contents show blank lines for popups that don't have 
a title (dunno why, they should show a URL).

title.$t: iframe shims not working properly

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.317.2 (Official Build 38193) dev URLs (if applicable) : http://tulrich.com/iframe_shims/ Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: OK IE 7: OK IE 8: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. open http://tulrich.com/iframe_shims/ 2. in the playground (halfway down the page), click "create flash plugin" 3. click "Create iframe | pos z, overlay" What is the expected result? The red square overlays the blue rectangle. What happens instead? The red square is obscured by the blue rectangle. If you scroll the page, the red square pops up on top where it should be. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. There's a layout test for iframe shim behavior -- is it malfunctioning?

title.$t: [Content Settings - Blocked Notification Icon] The Javascript blocked notification icon is still shown even the page has no content at all

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to "Content Settings" -> "Javascript" and set "Do not allow any site to run Javascript" 2. Access http://www.corp.google.com/~mdu/test.html What is the expected output? What do you see instead? test.html is a html which has no content and of course no javascript, ideally there should be no javascript blocked notification icon shown in omnibox since no Javscript is blocked, however now a Javascript notification icon is still shown. And in this case, all my extensions have been disabled, so there should also not be any javascript injected to the page. Issue is detected in Beta candidate 4.1.249.1011 (Official Build 39069), it also happens in latest trunk 5.0.331.0 (Developer Build 39220) Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Plugins are incorrectly reported as being blocked in cases where there are no plugin allocation attempts

Plugins are incorrectly reported as being blocked in cases where there are no 
plugin allocation attempts

This happens on pages like this:
http://codereview.chromium.org/660166

Observed using 5.0.338.0 (Developer Build 40083) on Windows.  I suspect that 
this is caused by http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/55206.

Just use with flash player on websites What is the expected result? What happens instead? Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. Tried it will the Adobe Labs 10.1.51.91 beta 3 and the recent released version 10.0.45.2 both had same results.(Hangs and crashes) Have had to on 2 occasions restart the computer because the browser hung and would not close. (OS is Windows 7 Ultimate)

title.$t: Extensions can't open notifications using relative URLs

content.$t:
From an extension view, webkitNotifications.createHTMLNotification(<relative url>) should work, but 
it doesn't.

title.$t: openDatabase() throws an exception when Block sites from setting any data is enabled

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.356.2 dev (also verified in 4.1.x stable) URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to Wrench -> Options -> Under the Hood -> Content settings and enable Block sites from setting any data. 2. Try to call openDatabase() from an HTML page within an extension. What is the expected result? It seems to me that it should still open the database. However, it definitely doesn't seem like an exception should be thrown. What happens instead? A INVALID_STATE_ERR: DOM Exception 11 exception is thrown. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. When Wrench -> Options -> Under the Hood -> Content settings -> Block sites from setting any data is enabled, openDatabase() throws the following exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: DOM Exception 11 This makes it effectively impossible to use HTML5 database routines from within our Chrome extension with this setting enabled. Interestingly, if Ask me when a site tries to set data is enabled instead, everything works as expected, without any prompts. So, this seems like a bug to me.

title.$t: Selection items in bookmark manager using keyboard is not working correctly

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Select an item in the tree using mouse 2. Press tab once to move the focus to the list 3. Press down to select an item in the list 4. Press shift tab to move the focus back to the tree 5. Press up or down to change folder 6. Press tab to move the focus back to the list 7. Press down What is the expected output? First item in the list should be selected. What do you see instead? Nothing is selected. I assume the clearing is not updating the selection model correctly.

title.$t: Expose folders only getter to the bookmarks API

content.$t:
Currently, the bookmarks manager needs to get all the folders to show the 
fully expanded tree. The bookmarks API does not expose a way do this so we 
get the entire tree. We have reports of people with thousands of bookmarks.

We should add a new method to chrome.bookmarks or 
chrome.experimental.bookmarkManager that only gives us the folders back.

title.$t: Modifying Omnibox URL prevents scheme from being copied

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.375.6 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Browse to a URL (e.g. http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=41467) 2. Select & Copy the entire Omnibar URL (e.g. code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail? id=41467) 3. Paste into a text editor. 4. Now modify the Omnibox URL (e.g. code.google.com/p/chromium/issues) 5. Select & Copy the entire Omnibar URL (e.g. code.google.com/p/chromium/issues) 6. Paste into a text editor. What is the expected result? http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues What happens instead? code.google.com/p/chromium/issues Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Make mixed-content indicators correct

content.$t:
For https with mixed content we show the https in the omnibox in gray. 
Visually this makes me think I shouldn't care (gray is usually used to de-
emphasize something). When I showed it to Glen he wasn't thrilled about it 
either and though we should be using red in this situation.

title.$t: Sometimes the plugin doesn't load on Youtube

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.396.0 (Build ufficiale 46416) dev URLs (if applicable) : http://www.youtube.com/user/Google#grid/user/12E3C2A3C2C732BC Other browsers tested: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: OK? IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go To any YouTube user defined playlist of videos 2. load the first one 3. What is the expected result? At the end of each video the next one should be loaded. What happens instead? SOMETIMES the next video is not loaded and a "Missing Plugin" appears instead. I am forced to click on that video to reload. I suppose the flash plugin instance is not cleared properly or there is something wrong in Youtube code. It seems to work fine with firefox.

title.$t: ChromeFrame allows navigation to "gcf:" urls

content.$t:
in MSIE, in a Trident ChromeFrame window, a webpage can open any "about:" url using the following code:

    window.open('gcf:about:version');

in Chrome, the page navigates to "about:blank" for all "gcf:about:..." and "about:..." urls. It seems to me that a webpage should not be able to open "about:" urls in MSIE either (other than "about:blank").

Assigning security - not sure immediately how to abuse this, but IIRC there is a security reason why webpages in the internet cannot open "about:" urls in Chrome. Feel free to disagree and remove the label if you know otherwise.

title.$t: ChromeFrame crash in IE8 due to a zombie IInternetProtocol protocol data mapping

content.$t:
ChromeFrame can cause IE to behave erratically or crash if the underlying IInternetProtocol pointer is reused for a new transaction leaving the protdata protocol mapping intact, which is wrong.

The ProtData needs to be invalidated when the protocol is destroyed ideally.

title.$t: Notification can go away while settings menu is open.

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Display a notification. 2.Click on the "settings" icon on the top right of the notification to open the settings menu for that notification. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Notification should stay visible and frontmost while the menu is open. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. Notification bubble can disappear or go to background while the settings menu for the notification is displayed.
